4542  if ((buf = (NV_U_BYTE *)calloc(size, sizeof(NV_U_BYTE))) == NULL) {
4543  perror("Allocating node write buffer");
4544  exit(-1);
4545  }
4546  memset(buf, 0, size);
4547 
4548  for (i = 0; i < hd.pub.constituents; ++i) {
4549  NV_U_INT32 j;
4550  for (j = 0; j < hd.pub.number_of_years; ++j) {
4551  temp_int = NINT(hd.node_factor[i][j] * hd.node_scale) - hd.node_offset;
4552  assert(temp_int >= 0);
4553  bit_pack(buf, pos, hd.node_bits, temp_int);
4554  pos += hd.node_bits;
4555  }
4556  }
4557 
4558  chk_fwrite(buf, size, 1, fp);
4559  free(buf);
4560 }
4561 
4562 /*****************************************************************************\
4563 
4564  Function unpack_string - Safely unpack a string into a
4565  fixed-length buffer.
4566 
4567  Synopsis unpack_string (buf, bufsize, pos, outbuf, outbuflen, desc);
4568 
4569  NV_U_BYTE *buf input buffer
4570  NV_U_INT32 bufsize size of input buffer in bytes
4571  NV_U_INT32 *pos current bit-position in buf
4572  (in-out parameter)
4573  NV_CHAR *outbuf fixed-length string-buffer
4574  NV_U_INT32 outbuflen size of outbuf in bytes
4575  NV_CHAR *desc description of the field being
4576  unpacked for use in warning
4577  messages when truncation occurs
4578 
4579  Returns void
4580 
4581  Author David Flater
4582  Date 2004-09-30
4583 
4584  pos will be left at the start of the next field even if the string
4585  gets truncated.
4586 
4587 \*****************************************************************************/
4588 
4589 static void unpack_string(NV_U_BYTE *buf, NV_U_INT32 bufsize, NV_U_INT32 *pos,
4590  NV_CHAR *outbuf, NV_U_INT32 outbuflen,
4591  const NV_CHAR *desc) {
4592  NV_U_INT32 i;
4593  NV_CHAR c = 'x';
4594  assert(buf);
4595  assert(pos);
4596  assert(outbuf);
4597  assert(desc);
4598  assert(outbuflen);
4599  --outbuflen;
4600  bufsize <<= 3;
4601  for (i = 0; c; ++i) {
4602  assert(*pos < bufsize); /* Catch unterminated strings */
4603  c = bit_unpack(buf, *pos, 8);
4604  (*pos) += 8;
4605  if (i < outbuflen) {
4606  outbuf[i] = c;
4607  } else if (i == outbuflen) {
4608  outbuf[i] = '\0';
4609  if (c) {
4610  LOG_ERROR("libtcd warning: truncating overlong %s\n", desc);
4611  LOG_ERROR("The offending string starts with:\n%s\n", outbuf);
4612  }
4613  }
4614  }
4615 }
4616 
4617 /*****************************************************************************\
4618 
4619  Function unpack_partial_tide_record - unpacks the "header" portion
4620  of a tide record from the supplied buffer
4621 
4622  Synopsis unpack_partial_tide_record (buf, rec, pos);
4623 
4624  NV_U_BYTE *buf input buffer
4625  NV_U_INT32 bufsize size of input buffer in bytes
4626  TIDE_RECORD *rec tide record
4627  NV_U_INT32 *pos final position in buffer after
4628  unpacking the header
4629 
4630  Returns void
4631 
4632  Author Jan C. Depner
4633  Date 08/01/02
4634 
4635  See libtcd.html for changelog.
4636 
4637 \*****************************************************************************/
4638 
4639 static void unpack_partial_tide_record(NV_U_BYTE *buf, NV_U_INT32 bufsize,
4640  TIDE_RECORD *rec, NV_U_INT32 *pos) {
4641  NV_INT32 temp_int;
4642 
4643  assert(buf);
4644  assert(rec);
4645  assert(pos);
4646 
4647  *pos = 0;
4648 
4649  rec->header.record_size = bit_unpack(buf, *pos, hd.record_size_bits);
4650  *pos += hd.record_size_bits;
4651 
4652  rec->header.record_type = bit_unpack(buf, *pos, hd.record_type_bits);
4653  *pos += hd.record_type_bits;
4654 
4655  temp_int = signed_bit_unpack(buf, *pos, hd.latitude_bits);
4656  rec->header.latitude = (NV_FLOAT64)temp_int / hd.latitude_scale;
4657  *pos += hd.latitude_bits;
4658 
4659  temp_int = signed_bit_unpack(buf, *pos, hd.longitude_bits);
4660  rec->header.longitude = (NV_FLOAT64)temp_int / hd.longitude_scale;
4661  *pos += hd.longitude_bits;
4662 
4663  /* This ordering doesn't match everywhere else but there's no technical
4664  reason to change it from its V1 ordering. */
4665 
4666  rec->header.tzfile = bit_unpack(buf, *pos, hd.tzfile_bits);
4667  *pos += hd.tzfile_bits;
4668 
4669  unpack_string(buf, bufsize, pos, rec->header.name, ONELINER_LENGTH,
4670  "station name");
4671 
4672  rec->header.reference_station = signed_bit_unpack(buf, *pos, hd.station_bits);
4673  *pos += hd.station_bits;
4674 
4675  assert(*pos <= bufsize * 8);
4676 }
4677 
4678 /*****************************************************************************\
4679 
4680  Function read_partial_tide_record - reads the "header" portion
4681  of a tide record from the database. This is used to index
4682  the database on opening.
4683 
4684  Synopsis read_partial_tide_record (num, rec);
4685 
4686  NV_INT32 num record number
4687  TIDE_RECORD *rec tide record
4688 
4689  Returns NV_INT32 record number read
4690 
4691  Author Jan C. Depner
4692  Date 08/01/02
4693 
4694  See libtcd.html for changelog.
4695 
4696 \*****************************************************************************/
4697 
4698 static NV_INT32 read_partial_tide_record(NV_INT32 num, TIDE_RECORD *rec) {
4699  NV_U_BYTE *buf;
4700  NV_U_INT32 maximum_possible_size, pos;
4701 
4702  if (!fp) {
4703  LOG_ERROR(
4704  "libtcd error: attempt to access database when database not open\n");
4705  exit(-1);
4706  }
4707 
4708  assert(rec);
4709 
4710  /* Read just the record size, record type, position, time zone, and
4711  name. */
4712 
4713  maximum_possible_size = hd.record_size_bits + hd.record_type_bits +
4714  hd.latitude_bits + hd.longitude_bits +
4715  hd.tzfile_bits + (ONELINER_LENGTH * 8) +
4716  hd.station_bits;
4717  maximum_possible_size = bits2bytes(maximum_possible_size);
4718 
4719  if ((buf = (NV_U_BYTE *)calloc(maximum_possible_size, sizeof(NV_U_BYTE))) ==
4720  NULL) {
4721  perror("Allocating partial tide record buffer");
4722  exit(-1);
4723  }
4724 
4725  current_record = num;
4726  fseek(fp, tindex[num].address, SEEK_SET);
4727  /* DWF 2007-12-02: This is the one place where a short read would not
4728  necessarily mean catastrophe. We don't know how long the partial
4729  record actually is yet, and it's possible that the full record will
4730  be shorter than maximum_possible_size. */
4731  size_t size = fread(buf, 1, maximum_possible_size, fp);
4732  unpack_partial_tide_record(buf, size, rec, &pos);
4733  free(buf);
4734  return (num);
4735 }
4736 
4737 /*****************************************************************************\
4738 
4739  Function read_tide_db_header - reads the tide database header
4740 
4741  Synopsis read_tide_db_header ();
4742 
4743  Returns NV_BOOL NVTrue if header is correct
4744 
4745  Author Jan C. Depner
4746  Date 08/01/02
4747 
4748  See libtcd.html for changelog.
4749 
4750 \*****************************************************************************/
4751 
4752 static NV_BOOL read_tide_db_header() {
4753  NV_INT32 temp_int;
4754  NV_CHAR varin[ONELINER_LENGTH], *info;
4755  NV_U_INT32 utemp, i, j, pos, size, key_count;
4756  NV_U_BYTE *buf, checksum_c[5];
4757  TIDE_RECORD rec;
4758 
4759  if (!fp) {
4760  LOG_ERROR(
4761  "libtcd error: attempt to access database when database not open\n");
4762  exit(-1);
4763  }
4764 
4765  strcpy(hd.pub.version, "NO VERSION");
4766 
4767  /* Compute the number of key phrases there are to match. */
4768  key_count = sizeof(keys) / sizeof(KEY);
4769 
4770  /* Zero out the header structure. */
4771  memset(&hd, 0, sizeof(hd));
4772 
4773  /* Handle the ASCII header data. */
4774  while (fgets(varin, sizeof(varin), fp) != NULL) {
4775  if (strlen(varin) == ONELINER_LENGTH - 1) {
4776  if (varin[ONELINER_LENGTH - 2] != '\n') {
4777  LOG_ERROR("libtcd error: header line too long, begins with:\n");
4778  LOG_ERROR("%s\n", varin);
4779  LOG_ERROR("in file %s\n", filename);
4780  LOG_ERROR("Configured limit is %u\n", ONELINER_LENGTH - 1);
4781  fclose(fp);
4782  return NVFalse;
4783  }
4784  }
4785 
4786  if (strstr(varin, "[END OF ASCII HEADER DATA]")) break;
4787 
4788  /* All other lines must be field = value */
4789  info = strchr(varin, '=');
4790  if (!info) {
4791  LOG_ERROR("libtcd error: invalid tide db header line:\n");
4792  LOG_ERROR("%s", varin);
4793  LOG_ERROR("in file %s\n", filename);
4794  fclose(fp);
4795  return NVFalse;
4796  }
4797  ++info;
4798 
4799  /* Scan the fields per "keys" defined in tide_db_header.h. */
4800  for (i = 0; i < key_count; ++i) {
4801  if (strstr(varin, keys[i].keyphrase)) {
4802  if (!strcmp(keys[i].datatype, "cstr"))
4803  strcpy((char *)keys[i].address.cstr, clip_string(info));
4804  else if (!strcmp(keys[i].datatype, "i32")) {
4805  if (sscanf(info, "%d", keys[i].address.i32) != 1) {
4806  LOG_ERROR("libtcd error: invalid tide db header line:\n");
4807  LOG_ERROR("%s", varin);
4808  LOG_ERROR("in file %s\n", filename);
4809  fclose(fp);
4810  return NVFalse;
4811  }
4812  } else if (!strcmp(keys[i].datatype, "ui32")) {
4813  if (sscanf(info, "%u", keys[i].address.ui32) != 1) {
4814  LOG_ERROR("libtcd error: invalid tide db header line:\n");
4815  LOG_ERROR("%s", varin);
4816  LOG_ERROR("in file %s\n", filename);
4817  fclose(fp);
4818  return NVFalse;
4819  }
4820  } else
4821  assert(0);
4822  }
4823  }
4824  }
4825 
4826  /* We didn't get a valid version string. */
4827 
4828  if (!strcmp(hd.pub.version, "NO VERSION")) {
4829  LOG_ERROR("libtcd error: no version found in tide db header\n");
4830  LOG_ERROR("in file %s\n", filename);
4831  fclose(fp);
4832  return NVFalse;
4833  }
4834 
4835  /* If no major or minor rev, they're 0 (pre-1.99) */
4836  if (hd.pub.major_rev > LIBTCD_MAJOR_REV) {
4837  LOG_ERROR(
4838  "libtcd error: major revision in TCD file (%u) exceeds major revision "
4839  "of\n",
4840  hd.pub.major_rev);
4841  LOG_ERROR("libtcd (%u). You must upgrade libtcd to read this file.\n",
4842  LIBTCD_MAJOR_REV);
4843  fclose(fp);
4844  return NVFalse;
4845  }
4846 
4847  /* Move to end of ASCII header. */
4848  fseek(fp, hd.header_size, SEEK_SET);
4849 
4850  /* Read and check the checksum. */
4851 
4852  chk_fread(checksum_c, 4, 1, fp);
4853  utemp = bit_unpack(checksum_c, 0, 32);
4854 
4855  if (utemp != header_checksum()) {
4856 #ifdef COMPAT114
4857  if (utemp != old_header_checksum()) {
4858  LOG_ERROR("libtcd error: header checksum error in file %s\n", filename);
4859  LOG_ERROR(
4860  "Someone may have modified the ASCII portion of the header (don't do that),\n\
4861 or it may just be corrupt.\n");
4862  fclose(fp);
4863  return NVFalse;
4864  }
4865 #else
4866  LOG_ERROR("libtcd error: header checksum error in file %s\n", filename);
4867  LOG_ERROR(
4868  "Someone may have modified the ASCII portion of the header (don't do that),\n\
4869 or it may be an ancient pre-version-1.02 TCD file, or it may just be corrupt.\n\
4870 Pre-version-1.02 TCD files can be read by building libtcd with COMPAT114\n\
4871 defined.\n");
4872  fclose(fp);
4873  return NVFalse;
4874 #endif
4875  }
4876  fseek(fp, hd.header_size + 4, SEEK_SET);
4877 
4878  /* Set the max possible restriction types based on the number of bits
4879  used. */
4880 
4881  hd.max_restriction_types = NINT(pow(2.0, (NV_FLOAT64)hd.restriction_bits));
4882 
4883  /* Set the max possible tzfiles based on the number of bits used. */
4884 
4885  hd.max_tzfiles = NINT(pow(2.0, (NV_FLOAT64)hd.tzfile_bits));
4886 
4887  /* Set the max possible countries based on the number of bits used. */
4888 
4889  hd.max_countries = NINT(pow(2.0, (NV_FLOAT64)hd.country_bits));
4890 
4891  /* Set the max possible datum types based on the number of bits
4892  used. */
4893 
4894  hd.max_datum_types = NINT(pow(2.0, (NV_FLOAT64)hd.datum_bits));
4895 
4896  /* Set the max possible legaleses based on the number of bits
4897  used. */
4898 
4899  if (hd.pub.major_rev < 2)
4900  hd.max_legaleses = 1;
4901  else
4902  hd.max_legaleses = NINT(pow(2.0, (NV_FLOAT64)hd.legalese_bits));
4903 
4904  /* NOTE : Using strcpy for character strings (no endian issue). */
4905 
4906  /* Read level units. */
4907 
4908  hd.level_unit =
4909  (NV_CHAR **)calloc(hd.pub.level_unit_types, sizeof(NV_CHAR *));
4910 
4911  if ((buf = (NV_U_BYTE *)calloc(hd.level_unit_size, sizeof(NV_U_BYTE))) ==
4912  NULL) {
4913  perror("Allocating level unit read buffer");
4914  exit(-1);
4915  }
4916 
4917  for (i = 0; i < hd.pub.level_unit_types; ++i) {
4918  chk_fread(buf, hd.level_unit_size, 1, fp);
4919  hd.level_unit[i] =
4920  (NV_CHAR *)calloc(strlen((char *)buf) + 1, sizeof(NV_CHAR));
4921  strcpy(hd.level_unit[i], (NV_CHAR *)buf);
4922  }
4923  free(buf);
4924 
4925  /* Read direction units. */
4926 
4927  hd.dir_unit = (NV_CHAR **)calloc(hd.pub.dir_unit_types, sizeof(NV_CHAR *));
4928 
4929  if ((buf = (NV_U_BYTE *)calloc(hd.dir_unit_size, sizeof(NV_U_BYTE))) ==
4930  NULL) {
4931  perror("Allocating dir unit read buffer");
4932  exit(-1);
4933  }
4934 
4935  for (i = 0; i < hd.pub.dir_unit_types; ++i) {
4936  chk_fread(buf, hd.dir_unit_size, 1, fp);
4937  hd.dir_unit[i] =
4938  (NV_CHAR *)calloc(strlen((char *)buf) + 1, sizeof(NV_CHAR));
4939  strcpy(hd.dir_unit[i], (NV_CHAR *)buf);
4940  }
4941  free(buf);
4942 
4943  /* Read restrictions. */
4944 
4945  utemp = ftell(fp);
4946  hd.restriction =
4947  (NV_CHAR **)calloc(hd.max_restriction_types, sizeof(NV_CHAR *));
4948 
4949  if ((buf = (NV_U_BYTE *)calloc(hd.restriction_size, sizeof(NV_U_BYTE))) ==
4950  NULL) {
4951  perror("Allocating restriction read buffer");
4952  exit(-1);
4953  }
4954 
4955  hd.pub.restriction_types = 0;
4956  for (i = 0; i < hd.max_restriction_types; ++i) {
4957  chk_fread(buf, hd.restriction_size, 1, fp);
4958  if (!strcmp((char *)buf, "__END__")) {
4959  hd.pub.restriction_types = i;
4960  break;
4961  }
4962  hd.restriction[i] =
4963  (NV_CHAR *)calloc(strlen((char *)buf) + 1, sizeof(NV_CHAR));
4964  strcpy(hd.restriction[i], (NV_CHAR *)buf);
4965  }
4966  free(buf);
4967  fseek(fp, utemp + hd.max_restriction_types * hd.restriction_size, SEEK_SET);
4968 
4969  /* Skip pedigrees. */
4970  if (hd.pub.major_rev < 2)
4971  fseek(fp, hd.pedigree_size * NINT(pow(2.0, (NV_FLOAT64)hd.pedigree_bits)),
4972  SEEK_CUR);
4973  hd.pub.pedigree_types = 1;
4974 
4975  /* Read tzfiles. */
4976 
4977  utemp = ftell(fp);
4978  hd.tzfile = (NV_CHAR **)calloc(hd.max_tzfiles, sizeof(NV_CHAR *));
4979 
4980  if ((buf = (NV_U_BYTE *)calloc(hd.tzfile_size, sizeof(NV_U_BYTE))) == NULL) {
4981  perror("Allocating tzfile read buffer");
4982  exit(-1);
4983  }
4984 
4985  hd.pub.tzfiles = 0;
4986  for (i = 0; i < hd.max_tzfiles; ++i) {
4987  chk_fread(buf, hd.tzfile_size, 1, fp);
4988  if (!strcmp((char *)buf, "__END__")) {
4989  hd.pub.tzfiles = i;
4990  break;
4991  }
4992  hd.tzfile[i] = (NV_CHAR *)calloc(strlen((char *)buf) + 1, sizeof(NV_CHAR));
4993  strcpy(hd.tzfile[i], (NV_CHAR *)buf);
4994  }
4995  free(buf);
4996  fseek(fp, utemp + hd.max_tzfiles * hd.tzfile_size, SEEK_SET);
4997 
4998  /* Read countries. */
4999 
5000  utemp = ftell(fp);
5001  hd.country = (NV_CHAR **)calloc(hd.max_countries, sizeof(NV_CHAR *));
5002 
5003  if ((buf = (NV_U_BYTE *)calloc(hd.country_size, sizeof(NV_U_BYTE))) == NULL) {
5004  perror("Allocating country read buffer");
5005  exit(-1);
5006  }
5007 
5008  hd.pub.countries = 0;
5009  for (i = 0; i < hd.max_countries; ++i) {
5010  chk_fread(buf, hd.country_size, 1, fp);
5011  if (!strcmp((char *)buf, "__END__")) {
5012  hd.pub.countries = i;
5013  break;
5014  }
5015  hd.country[i] = (NV_CHAR *)calloc(strlen((char *)buf) + 1, sizeof(NV_CHAR));
5016  strcpy(hd.country[i], (NV_CHAR *)buf);
5017  }
5018  free(buf);
5019  fseek(fp, utemp + hd.max_countries * hd.country_size, SEEK_SET);
5020 
5021  /* Read datums. */
5022 
5023  utemp = ftell(fp);
5024  hd.datum = (NV_CHAR **)calloc(hd.max_datum_types, sizeof(NV_CHAR *));
5025 
5026  if ((buf = (NV_U_BYTE *)calloc(hd.datum_size, sizeof(NV_U_BYTE))) == NULL) {
5027  perror("Allocating datum read buffer");
5028  exit(-1);
5029  }
5030 
5031  hd.pub.datum_types = 0;
5032  for (i = 0; i < hd.max_datum_types; ++i) {
5033  chk_fread(buf, hd.datum_size, 1, fp);
5034  if (!strcmp((char *)buf, "__END__")) {
5035  hd.pub.datum_types = i;
5036  break;
5037  }
5038  hd.datum[i] = (NV_CHAR *)calloc(strlen((char *)buf) + 1, sizeof(NV_CHAR));
5039  strcpy(hd.datum[i], (NV_CHAR *)buf);
5040  }
5041  free(buf);
5042  fseek(fp, utemp + hd.max_datum_types * hd.datum_size, SEEK_SET);
5043 
5044  /* Read legaleses. */
5045 
5046  if (hd.pub.major_rev < 2) {
5047  hd.legalese = (NV_CHAR **)malloc(sizeof(NV_CHAR *));
5048  assert(hd.legalese != NULL);
5049  hd.legalese[0] = (NV_CHAR *)malloc(5 * sizeof(NV_CHAR));
5050  assert(hd.legalese[0] != NULL);
5051  strcpy(hd.legalese[0], "NULL");
5052  hd.pub.legaleses = 1;
5053  } else {
5054  utemp = ftell(fp);
5055  hd.legalese = (NV_CHAR **)calloc(hd.max_legaleses, sizeof(NV_CHAR *));
5056 
5057  if ((buf = (NV_U_BYTE *)calloc(hd.legalese_size, sizeof(NV_U_BYTE))) ==
5058  NULL) {
5059  perror("Allocating legalese read buffer");
5060  exit(-1);
5061  }
5062 
5063  hd.pub.legaleses = 0;
5064  for (i = 0; i < hd.max_legaleses; ++i) {
5065  chk_fread(buf, hd.legalese_size, 1, fp);
5066  if (!strcmp((char *)buf, "__END__")) {
5067  hd.pub.legaleses = i;
5068  break;
5069  }
5070  hd.legalese[i] =
5071  (NV_CHAR *)calloc(strlen((char *)buf) + 1, sizeof(NV_CHAR));
5072  strcpy(hd.legalese[i], (NV_CHAR *)buf);
5073  }
5074  free(buf);
5075  fseek(fp, utemp + hd.max_legaleses * hd.legalese_size, SEEK_SET);
5076  }
5077 
5078  /* Read constituent names. */
5079 
5080  hd.constituent = (NV_CHAR **)calloc(hd.pub.constituents, sizeof(NV_CHAR *));
5081 
5082  if ((buf = (NV_U_BYTE *)calloc(hd.constituent_size, sizeof(NV_U_BYTE))) ==
5083  NULL) {
5084  perror("Allocating constituent read buffer");
5085  exit(-1);
5086  }
5087 
5088  for (i = 0; i < hd.pub.constituents; ++i) {
5089  chk_fread(buf, hd.constituent_size, 1, fp);
5090  hd.constituent[i] =
5091  (NV_CHAR *)calloc(strlen((char *)buf) + 1, sizeof(NV_CHAR));
5092  strcpy(hd.constituent[i], (NV_CHAR *)buf);
5093  }
5094  free(buf);
5095 
5096  if (hd.speed_offset < 0 || hd.equilibrium_offset < 0 || hd.node_offset < 0) {
5097  LOG_ERROR("libtcd WARNING: File: %s\n", filename);
5098  LOG_ERROR(
5099  "WARNING: This TCD file was created by a pre-version-1.11 libtcd.\n\
5100 Versions of libtcd prior to 1.11 contained a serious bug that can result\n\
5101 in overflows in the speeds, equilibrium arguments, or node factors. This\n\
5102 database should be rebuilt from the original data if possible.\n");
5103  }
5104 
5105  /* NOTE: Using bit_unpack to get integers. */
5106 
5107  /* Read speeds. */
5108 
5109  hd.speed = (NV_FLOAT64 *)calloc(hd.pub.constituents, sizeof(NV_FLOAT64));
5110 
5111  pos = 0;
5112  /* wasted byte bug in V1 */
5113  if (hd.pub.major_rev < 2)
5114  size = ((hd.pub.constituents * hd.speed_bits) / 8) + 1;
5115  else
5116  size = bits2bytes(hd.pub.constituents * hd.speed_bits);
5117 
5118  if ((buf = (NV_U_BYTE *)calloc(size, sizeof(NV_U_BYTE))) == NULL) {
5119  perror("Allocating speed read buffer");
5120  exit(-1);
5121  }
5122 
5123  chk_fread(buf, size, 1, fp);
5124 
5125  for (i = 0; i < hd.pub.constituents; ++i) {
5126  temp_int = bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.speed_bits);
5127  hd.speed[i] = (NV_FLOAT64)(temp_int + hd.speed_offset) / hd.speed_scale;
5128  pos += hd.speed_bits;
5129  assert(hd.speed[i] >= 0.0);
5130  }
5131  free(buf);
5132 
5133  /* Read equilibrium arguments. */
5134 
5135  hd.equilibrium =
5136  (NV_FLOAT32 **)calloc(hd.pub.constituents, sizeof(NV_FLOAT32 *));
5137 
5138  for (i = 0; i < hd.pub.constituents; ++i) {
5139  hd.equilibrium[i] =
5140  (NV_FLOAT32 *)calloc(hd.pub.number_of_years, sizeof(NV_FLOAT32));
5141  }
5142 
5143  pos = 0;
5144  /* wasted byte bug in V1 */
5145  if (hd.pub.major_rev < 2)
5146  size =
5147  ((hd.pub.constituents * hd.pub.number_of_years * hd.equilibrium_bits) /
5148  8) +
5149  1;
5150  else
5151  size = bits2bytes(hd.pub.constituents * hd.pub.number_of_years *
5152  hd.equilibrium_bits);
5153 
5154  if ((buf = (NV_U_BYTE *)calloc(size, sizeof(NV_U_BYTE))) == NULL) {
5155  perror("Allocating equilibrium read buffer");
5156  exit(-1);
5157  }
5158 
5159  chk_fread(buf, size, 1, fp);
5160 
5161  for (i = 0; i < hd.pub.constituents; ++i) {
5162  for (j = 0; j < hd.pub.number_of_years; ++j) {
5163  temp_int = bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.equilibrium_bits);
5164  hd.equilibrium[i][j] =
5165  (NV_FLOAT32)(temp_int + hd.equilibrium_offset) / hd.equilibrium_scale;
5166  pos += hd.equilibrium_bits;
5167  }
5168  }
5169  free(buf);
5170 
5171  /* Read node factors. */
5172 
5173  hd.node_factor =
5174  (NV_FLOAT32 **)calloc(hd.pub.constituents, sizeof(NV_FLOAT32 *));
5175 
5176  for (i = 0; i < hd.pub.constituents; ++i) {
5177  hd.node_factor[i] =
5178  (NV_FLOAT32 *)calloc(hd.pub.number_of_years, sizeof(NV_FLOAT32));
5179  }
5180 
5181  pos = 0;
5182  /* wasted byte bug in V1 */
5183  if (hd.pub.major_rev < 2)
5184  size =
5185  ((hd.pub.constituents * hd.pub.number_of_years * hd.node_bits) / 8) + 1;
5186  else
5187  size =
5188  bits2bytes(hd.pub.constituents * hd.pub.number_of_years * hd.node_bits);
5189 
5190  if ((buf = (NV_U_BYTE *)calloc(size, sizeof(NV_U_BYTE))) == NULL) {
5191  perror("Allocating node read buffer");
5192  exit(-1);
5193  }
5194 
5195  chk_fread(buf, size, 1, fp);
5196 
5197  for (i = 0; i < hd.pub.constituents; ++i) {
5198  for (j = 0; j < hd.pub.number_of_years; ++j) {
5199  temp_int = bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.node_bits);
5200  hd.node_factor[i][j] =
5201  (NV_FLOAT32)(temp_int + hd.node_offset) / hd.node_scale;
5202  pos += hd.node_bits;
5203  assert(hd.node_factor[i][j] > 0.0);
5204  }
5205  }
5206  free(buf);
5207 
5208  /* Read the header portion of all of the records in the file and save
5209  the record size, address, and name. */
5210 
5211  /* DWF added test for zero 2003-11-16 -- happens on create new db */
5212  if (hd.pub.number_of_records) {
5213  if ((tindex = (TIDE_INDEX *)calloc(hd.pub.number_of_records,
5214  sizeof(TIDE_INDEX))) == NULL) {
5215  perror("Allocating tide index");
5216  exit(-1);
5217  }
5218  /* Set the first address to be immediately after the header */
5219  tindex[0].address = ftell(fp);
5220  } else
5221  tindex = NULL; /* May as well be explicit... */
5222 
5223  for (i = 0; i < hd.pub.number_of_records; ++i) {
5224  /* Set the address for the next record so that
5225  read_partial_tide_record will know where to go. */
5226 
5227  if (i) tindex[i].address = tindex[i - 1].address + rec.header.record_size;
5228 
5229  read_partial_tide_record(i, &rec);
5230 
5231  /* Save the header info in the index. */
5232 
5233  tindex[i].record_size = rec.header.record_size;
5234  tindex[i].record_type = rec.header.record_type;
5235  tindex[i].reference_station = rec.header.reference_station;
5236  assert(rec.header.tzfile >= 0);
5237  tindex[i].tzfile = rec.header.tzfile;
5238  tindex[i].lat = NINT(rec.header.latitude * hd.latitude_scale);
5239  tindex[i].lon = NINT(rec.header.longitude * hd.longitude_scale);
5240 
5241  if ((tindex[i].name = (NV_CHAR *)calloc(strlen(rec.header.name) + 1,
5242  sizeof(NV_CHAR))) == NULL) {
5243  perror("Allocating index name memory");
5244  exit(-1);
5245  }
5246 
5247  strcpy(tindex[i].name, rec.header.name);
5248  }
5249 
5250  current_record = -1;
5251  current_index = -1;
5252 
5253  return (NVTrue);
5254 }
5255 
5256 /*****************************************************************************\
5257 
5258  Function open_tide_db - opens the tide database
5259 
5260  Synopsis open_tide_db (file);
5261 
5262  NV_CHAR *file database file name
5263 
5264  Returns NV_BOOL NVTrue if file opened
5265 
5266  Author Jan C. Depner
5267  Date 08/01/02
5268 
5269  See libtcd.html for changelog.
5270 
5271 \*****************************************************************************/
5272 
5273 NV_BOOL open_tide_db(const NV_CHAR *file) {
5274  assert(file);
5275  current_record = -1;
5276  current_index = -1;
5277  if (fp) {
5278  if (!strcmp(file, filename) && !modified)
5279  return NVTrue;
5280  else
5281  close_tide_db();
5282  }
5283  if ((fp = fopen(file, "rb+")) == NULL) {
5284  if ((fp = fopen(file, "rb")) == NULL) return (NVFalse);
5285  }
5286  boundscheck_monologue(file);
5287  strcpy(filename, file);
5288  return (read_tide_db_header());
5289 }
5290 
5291 /*****************************************************************************\
5292 
5293  Function close_tide_db - closes the tide database
5294 
5295  Synopsis close_tide_db ();
5296 
5297  Returns void
5298 
5299  Author Jan C. Depner
5300  Date 08/01/02
5301 
5302  See libtcd.html for changelog.
5303 
5304  If the global modified flag is true, the database header is rewritten
5305  before the database is closed. The modified flag is then cleared.
5306 
5307 \*****************************************************************************/
5308 
5309 void close_tide_db() {
5310  NV_U_INT32 i;
5311 
5312  if (!fp) {
5313  LOG_ERROR("libtcd warning: close_tide_db called when no database open\n");
5314  return;
5315  }
5316 
5317  /* If we've changed something in the file, write the header to reset
5318  the last modified time. */
5319 
5320  if (modified) write_tide_db_header();
5321 
5322  /* Free all of the temporary memory. */
5323 
5324  assert(hd.constituent);
5325  for (i = 0; i < hd.pub.constituents; ++i) {
5326  if (hd.constituent[i] != NULL) free(hd.constituent[i]);
5327  }
5328  free(hd.constituent);
5329  hd.constituent = NULL;
5330 
5331  if (hd.speed != NULL) free(hd.speed);
5332 
5333  assert(hd.equilibrium);
5334  for (i = 0; i < hd.pub.constituents; ++i) {
5335  if (hd.equilibrium[i] != NULL) free(hd.equilibrium[i]);
5336  }
5337  free(hd.equilibrium);
5338  hd.equilibrium = NULL;
5339 
5340  assert(hd.node_factor);
5341  for (i = 0; i < hd.pub.constituents; ++i) {
5342  if (hd.node_factor[i] != NULL) free(hd.node_factor[i]);
5343  }
5344  free(hd.node_factor);
5345  hd.node_factor = NULL;
5346 
5347  assert(hd.level_unit);
5348  for (i = 0; i < hd.pub.level_unit_types; ++i) {
5349  if (hd.level_unit[i] != NULL) free(hd.level_unit[i]);
5350  }
5351  free(hd.level_unit);
5352  hd.level_unit = NULL;
5353 
5354  assert(hd.dir_unit);
5355  for (i = 0; i < hd.pub.dir_unit_types; ++i) {
5356  if (hd.dir_unit[i] != NULL) free(hd.dir_unit[i]);
5357  }
5358  free(hd.dir_unit);
5359  hd.dir_unit = NULL;
5360 
5361  assert(hd.restriction);
5362  for (i = 0; i < hd.max_restriction_types; ++i) {
5363  if (hd.restriction[i] != NULL) free(hd.restriction[i]);
5364  }
5365  free(hd.restriction);
5366  hd.restriction = NULL;
5367 
5368  assert(hd.legalese);
5369  for (i = 0; i < hd.max_legaleses; ++i) {
5370  if (hd.legalese[i] != NULL) free(hd.legalese[i]);
5371  }
5372  free(hd.legalese);
5373  hd.legalese = NULL;
5374 
5375  assert(hd.tzfile);
5376  for (i = 0; i < hd.max_tzfiles; ++i) {
5377  if (hd.tzfile[i] != NULL) free(hd.tzfile[i]);
5378  }
5379  free(hd.tzfile);
5380  hd.tzfile = NULL;
5381 
5382  assert(hd.country);
5383  for (i = 0; i < hd.max_countries; ++i) {
5384  if (hd.country[i] != NULL) free(hd.country[i]);
5385  }
5386  free(hd.country);
5387  hd.country = NULL;
5388 
5389  assert(hd.datum);
5390  for (i = 0; i < hd.max_datum_types; ++i) {
5391  if (hd.datum[i] != NULL) free(hd.datum[i]);
5392  }
5393  free(hd.datum);
5394  hd.datum = NULL;
5395 
5396  /* tindex will still be null on create_tide_db */
5397  if (tindex) {
5398  for (i = 0; i < hd.pub.number_of_records; ++i) {
5399  if (tindex[i].name) free(tindex[i].name);
5400  }
5401  free(tindex);
5402  tindex = NULL;
5403  }
5404 
5405  fclose(fp);
5406  fp = NULL;
5407  modified = NVFalse;
5408 
5409  /* Don't nullify the filename; there are places in the code where
5410  open_tide_db (filename) is invoked after close_tide_db(). This
5411  does not break the cache logic in open_tide_db because tindex
5412  is still nullified. */
5413 }
5414 
5415 /*****************************************************************************\
5416 
5417  Function create_tide_db - creates the tide database
5418 
5419  Synopsis create_tide_db (file, constituents, constituent, speed,
5420  start_year, num_years, equilibrium, node_factor);
5421 
5422  NV_CHAR *file database file name
5423  NV_U_INT32 constituents number of constituents
5424  NV_CHAR *constituent[] constituent names
5425  NV_FLOAT64 *speed speed values
5426  NV_INT32 start_year start year
5427  NV_U_INT32 num_years number of years
5428  NV_FLOAT32 *equilibrium[] equilibrium arguments
5429  NV_FLOAT32 *node_factor[] node factors
5430 
5431  Returns NV_BOOL NVTrue if file created
5432 
5433  Author Jan C. Depner
5434  Date 08/01/02
5435 
5436  See libtcd.html for changelog.
5437 
5438 \*****************************************************************************/
5439 
5440 NV_BOOL create_tide_db(const NV_CHAR *file, NV_U_INT32 constituents,
5441  NV_CHAR const *const constituent[],
5442  const NV_FLOAT64 *speed, NV_INT32 start_year,
5443  NV_U_INT32 num_years,
5444  NV_FLOAT32 const *const equilibrium[],
5445  NV_FLOAT32 const *const node_factor[]) {
5446  NV_U_INT32 i, j;
5447  NV_FLOAT64 min_value, max_value;
5448  NV_INT32 temp_int;
5449 
5450  /* Validate input */
5451  assert(file);
5452  assert(constituent);
5453  assert(speed);
5454  assert(equilibrium);
5455  assert(node_factor);
5456  for (i = 0; i < constituents; ++i) {
5457  if (speed[i] < 0.0) {
5458  LOG_ERROR(
5459  "libtcd create_tide_db: somebody tried to set a negative speed "
5460  "(%f)\n",
5461  speed[i]);
5462  return NVFalse;
5463  }
5464  for (j = 0; j < num_years; ++j) {
5465  if (node_factor[i][j] <= 0.0) {
5466  LOG_ERROR(
5467  "libtcd create_tide_db: somebody tried to set a negative or zero "
5468  "node factor (%f)\n",
5469  node_factor[i][j]);
5470  return NVFalse;
5471  }
5472  }
5473  }
5474 
5475  if (fp) close_tide_db();
5476 
5477  if ((fp = fopen(file, "wb+")) == NULL) {
5478  perror(file);
5479  return (NVFalse);
5480  }
5481 
5482  /* Zero out the header structure. */
5483 
5484  memset(&hd, 0, sizeof(hd));
5485 
5486  hd.pub.major_rev = LIBTCD_MAJOR_REV;
5487  hd.pub.minor_rev = LIBTCD_MINOR_REV;
5488 
5489  hd.header_size = DEFAULT_HEADER_SIZE;
5490  hd.pub.number_of_records = DEFAULT_NUMBER_OF_RECORDS;
5491 
5492  hd.pub.start_year = start_year;
5493  hd.pub.number_of_years = num_years;
5494 
5495  hd.pub.constituents = constituents;
5496 
5497  /* Constituent names. */
5498 
5499  hd.constituent = (NV_CHAR **)calloc(hd.pub.constituents, sizeof(NV_CHAR *));
5500  for (i = 0; i < hd.pub.constituents; ++i) {
5501  hd.constituent[i] =
5502  (NV_CHAR *)calloc(strlen(constituent[i]) + 1, sizeof(NV_CHAR));
5503  strcpy(hd.constituent[i], constituent[i]);
5504  }
5505 
5506  /* A constituent count is stored with each reference station record,
5507  and it uses constituent_bits, so we need to be able to store
5508  the count itself (not just the values 0..count-1). */
5509  hd.constituent_bits = calculate_bits(hd.pub.constituents);
5510 
5511  /* Set all of the speed attributes. */
5512 
5513  hd.speed = (NV_FLOAT64 *)calloc(hd.pub.constituents, sizeof(NV_FLOAT64));
5514 
5515  hd.speed_scale = DEFAULT_SPEED_SCALE;
5516  min_value = 99999999.0;
5517  max_value = -99999999.0;
5518  for (i = 0; i < hd.pub.constituents; ++i) {
5519  if (speed[i] < min_value) min_value = speed[i];
5520  if (speed[i] > max_value) max_value = speed[i];
5521 
5522  hd.speed[i] = speed[i];
5523  }
5524 
5525  /* DWF fixed sign reversal 2003-11-16 */
5526  /* DWF harmonized rounding with the way it is done in write_tide_db_header
5527  2007-01-22 */
5528  hd.speed_offset = (NINT(min_value * hd.speed_scale));
5529  temp_int = NINT(max_value * hd.speed_scale) - hd.speed_offset;
5530  assert(temp_int >= 0);
5531  hd.speed_bits = calculate_bits((NV_U_INT32)temp_int);
5532  /* Generally 31. With signed ints we don't have any bits to spare. */
5533  assert(hd.speed_bits < 32);
5534 
5535  /* Set all of the equilibrium attributes. */
5536 
5537  hd.equilibrium =
5538  (NV_FLOAT32 **)calloc(hd.pub.constituents, sizeof(NV_FLOAT32 *));
5539 
5540  hd.equilibrium_scale = DEFAULT_EQUILIBRIUM_SCALE;
5541  min_value = 99999999.0;
5542  max_value = -99999999.0;
5543  for (i = 0; i < hd.pub.constituents; ++i) {
5544  hd.equilibrium[i] =
5545  (NV_FLOAT32 *)calloc(hd.pub.number_of_years, sizeof(NV_FLOAT32));
5546  for (j = 0; j < hd.pub.number_of_years; ++j) {
5547  if (equilibrium[i][j] < min_value) min_value = equilibrium[i][j];
5548  if (equilibrium[i][j] > max_value) max_value = equilibrium[i][j];
5549 
5550  hd.equilibrium[i][j] = equilibrium[i][j];
5551  }
5552  }
5553 
5554  /* DWF fixed sign reversal 2003-11-16 */
5555  /* DWF harmonized rounding with the way it is done in write_tide_db_header
5556  2007-01-22 */
5557  hd.equilibrium_offset = (NINT(min_value * hd.equilibrium_scale));
5558  temp_int = NINT(max_value * hd.equilibrium_scale) - hd.equilibrium_offset;
5559  assert(temp_int >= 0);
5560  hd.equilibrium_bits = calculate_bits((NV_U_INT32)temp_int);
5561 
5562  /* Set all of the node factor attributes. */
5563 
5564  hd.node_factor =
5565  (NV_FLOAT32 **)calloc(hd.pub.constituents, sizeof(NV_FLOAT32 *));
5566 
5567  hd.node_scale = DEFAULT_NODE_SCALE;
5568  min_value = 99999999.0;
5569  max_value = -99999999.0;
5570  for (i = 0; i < hd.pub.constituents; ++i) {
5571  hd.node_factor[i] =
5572  (NV_FLOAT32 *)calloc(hd.pub.number_of_years, sizeof(NV_FLOAT32));
5573  for (j = 0; j < hd.pub.number_of_years; ++j) {
5574  if (node_factor[i][j] < min_value) min_value = node_factor[i][j];
5575  if (node_factor[i][j] > max_value) max_value = node_factor[i][j];
5576 
5577  hd.node_factor[i][j] = node_factor[i][j];
5578  }
5579  }
5580 
5581  /* DWF fixed sign reversal 2003-11-16 */
5582  /* DWF harmonized rounding with the way it is done in write_tide_db_header
5583  2007-01-22 */
5584  hd.node_offset = (NINT(min_value * hd.node_scale));
5585  temp_int = NINT(max_value * hd.node_scale) - hd.node_offset;
5586  assert(temp_int >= 0);
5587  hd.node_bits = calculate_bits((NV_U_INT32)temp_int);
5588 
5589  /* Default city. */
5590 
5591  hd.amplitude_bits = DEFAULT_AMPLITUDE_BITS;
5592  hd.amplitude_scale = DEFAULT_AMPLITUDE_SCALE;
5593  hd.epoch_bits = DEFAULT_EPOCH_BITS;
5594  hd.epoch_scale = DEFAULT_EPOCH_SCALE;
5595 
5596  hd.record_type_bits = DEFAULT_RECORD_TYPE_BITS;
5597  hd.latitude_bits = DEFAULT_LATITUDE_BITS;
5598  hd.latitude_scale = DEFAULT_LATITUDE_SCALE;
5599  hd.longitude_bits = DEFAULT_LONGITUDE_BITS;
5600  hd.longitude_scale = DEFAULT_LONGITUDE_SCALE;
5601  hd.record_size_bits = DEFAULT_RECORD_SIZE_BITS;
5602 
5603  hd.station_bits = DEFAULT_STATION_BITS;
5604 
5605  hd.datum_offset_bits = DEFAULT_DATUM_OFFSET_BITS;
5606  hd.datum_offset_scale = DEFAULT_DATUM_OFFSET_SCALE;
5607  hd.date_bits = DEFAULT_DATE_BITS;
5608  hd.months_on_station_bits = DEFAULT_MONTHS_ON_STATION_BITS;
5609  hd.confidence_value_bits = DEFAULT_CONFIDENCE_VALUE_BITS;
5610 
5611  hd.time_bits = DEFAULT_TIME_BITS;
5612  hd.level_add_bits = DEFAULT_LEVEL_ADD_BITS;
5613  hd.level_add_scale = DEFAULT_LEVEL_ADD_SCALE;
5614  hd.level_multiply_bits = DEFAULT_LEVEL_MULTIPLY_BITS;
5615  hd.level_multiply_scale = DEFAULT_LEVEL_MULTIPLY_SCALE;
5616  hd.direction_bits = DEFAULT_DIRECTION_BITS;
5617 
5618  hd.constituent_size = DEFAULT_CONSTITUENT_SIZE;
5619  hd.level_unit_size = DEFAULT_LEVEL_UNIT_SIZE;
5620  hd.dir_unit_size = DEFAULT_DIR_UNIT_SIZE;
5621  hd.restriction_size = DEFAULT_RESTRICTION_SIZE;
5622  hd.tzfile_size = DEFAULT_TZFILE_SIZE;
5623  hd.country_size = DEFAULT_COUNTRY_SIZE;
5624  hd.datum_size = DEFAULT_DATUM_SIZE;
5625  hd.legalese_size = DEFAULT_LEGALESE_SIZE;
5626 
5627  /* Level units. */
5628 
5629  hd.pub.level_unit_types = DEFAULT_LEVEL_UNIT_TYPES;
5630  hd.level_unit_bits = calculate_bits(hd.pub.level_unit_types - 1);
5631 
5632  hd.level_unit =
5633  (NV_CHAR **)calloc(hd.pub.level_unit_types, sizeof(NV_CHAR *));
5634  for (i = 0; i < hd.pub.level_unit_types; ++i) {
5635  hd.level_unit[i] =
5636  (NV_CHAR *)calloc(strlen(level_unit[i]) + 1, sizeof(NV_CHAR));
5637  strcpy(hd.level_unit[i], level_unit[i]);
5638  }
5639 
5640  /* Direction units. */
5641 
5642  hd.pub.dir_unit_types = DEFAULT_DIR_UNIT_TYPES;
5643  hd.dir_unit_bits = calculate_bits(hd.pub.dir_unit_types - 1);
5644 
5645  hd.dir_unit = (NV_CHAR **)calloc(hd.pub.dir_unit_types, sizeof(NV_CHAR *));
5646  for (i = 0; i < hd.pub.dir_unit_types; ++i) {
5647  hd.dir_unit[i] =
5648  (NV_CHAR *)calloc(strlen(dir_unit[i]) + 1, sizeof(NV_CHAR));
5649  strcpy(hd.dir_unit[i], dir_unit[i]);
5650  }
5651 
5652  /* Restrictions. */
5653 
5654  hd.restriction_bits = DEFAULT_RESTRICTION_BITS;
5655  hd.max_restriction_types = NINT(pow(2.0, (NV_FLOAT64)hd.restriction_bits));
5656  hd.pub.restriction_types = DEFAULT_RESTRICTION_TYPES;
5657 
5658  hd.restriction =
5659  (NV_CHAR **)calloc(hd.max_restriction_types, sizeof(NV_CHAR *));
5660  for (i = 0; i < hd.max_restriction_types; ++i) {
5661  if (i == hd.pub.restriction_types) break;
5662 
5663  hd.restriction[i] =
5664  (NV_CHAR *)calloc(strlen(restriction[i]) + 1, sizeof(NV_CHAR));
5665  strcpy(hd.restriction[i], restriction[i]);
5666  }
5667 
5668  /* Legaleses. */
5669 
5670  hd.legalese_bits = DEFAULT_LEGALESE_BITS;
5671  hd.max_legaleses = NINT(pow(2.0, (NV_FLOAT64)hd.legalese_bits));
5672  hd.pub.legaleses = DEFAULT_LEGALESES;
5673 
5674  hd.legalese = (NV_CHAR **)calloc(hd.max_legaleses, sizeof(NV_CHAR *));
5675  for (i = 0; i < hd.max_legaleses; ++i) {
5676  if (i == hd.pub.legaleses) break;
5677 
5678  hd.legalese[i] =
5679  (NV_CHAR *)calloc(strlen(legalese[i]) + 1, sizeof(NV_CHAR));
5680  strcpy(hd.legalese[i], legalese[i]);
5681  }
5682 
5683  /* Tzfiles. */
5684 
5685  hd.tzfile_bits = DEFAULT_TZFILE_BITS;
5686  hd.max_tzfiles = NINT(pow(2.0, (NV_FLOAT64)hd.tzfile_bits));
5687  hd.pub.tzfiles = DEFAULT_TZFILES;
5688 
5689  hd.tzfile = (NV_CHAR **)calloc(hd.max_tzfiles, sizeof(NV_CHAR *));
5690  for (i = 0; i < hd.max_tzfiles; ++i) {
5691  if (i == hd.pub.tzfiles) break;
5692 
5693  hd.tzfile[i] = (NV_CHAR *)calloc(strlen(tzfile[i]) + 1, sizeof(NV_CHAR));
5694  strcpy(hd.tzfile[i], tzfile[i]);
5695  }
5696 
5697  /* Countries. */
5698 
5699  hd.country_bits = DEFAULT_COUNTRY_BITS;
5700  hd.max_countries = NINT(pow(2.0, (NV_FLOAT64)hd.country_bits));
5701  hd.pub.countries = DEFAULT_COUNTRIES;
5702 
5703  hd.country = (NV_CHAR **)calloc(hd.max_countries, sizeof(NV_CHAR *));
5704  for (i = 0; i < hd.max_countries; ++i) {
5705  if (i == hd.pub.countries) break;
5706 
5707  hd.country[i] = (NV_CHAR *)calloc(strlen(country[i]) + 1, sizeof(NV_CHAR));
5708  strcpy(hd.country[i], country[i]);
5709  }
5710 
5711  /* Datums. */
5712 
5713  hd.datum_bits = DEFAULT_DATUM_BITS;
5714  hd.max_datum_types = NINT(pow(2.0, (NV_FLOAT64)hd.datum_bits));
5715  hd.pub.datum_types = DEFAULT_DATUM_TYPES;
5716 
5717  hd.datum = (NV_CHAR **)calloc(hd.max_datum_types, sizeof(NV_CHAR *));
5718  for (i = 0; i < hd.max_datum_types; ++i) {
5719  if (i == hd.pub.datum_types) break;
5720 
5721  hd.datum[i] = (NV_CHAR *)calloc(strlen(datum[i]) + 1, sizeof(NV_CHAR));
5722  strcpy(hd.datum[i], datum[i]);
5723  }
5724 
5725  /* Write the header to the file and close. */
5726 
5727  modified = NVTrue;
5728  close_tide_db();
5729 
5730  /* Re-open it and read the header from the file. */
5731 
5732  i = (open_tide_db(file));
5733 
5734  /* Set the correct end of file position since the one in the header is
5735  set to 0. */
5736  hd.end_of_file = ftell(fp);
5737  /* DWF 2004-08-15: if the original program exits without adding any
5738  records, that doesn't help! Rewrite the header with correct
5739  end_of_file. */
5740  write_tide_db_header();
5741 
5742  return (i);
5743 }
5744 
5745 /*****************************************************************************\
5746  DWF 2004-10-13
5747  Used in check_tide_record.
5748 \*****************************************************************************/
5749 static NV_BOOL check_date(NV_U_INT32 date) {
5750  if (date) {
5751  unsigned m, d;
5752  date %= 10000;
5753  m = date / 100;
5754  d = date % 100;
5755  if (m < 1 || m > 12 || d < 1 || d > 31) return NVFalse;
5756  }
5757  return NVTrue;
5758 }
5759 
5760 /*****************************************************************************\
5761  DWF 2004-10-13
5762  Returns true iff a record is valid enough to write. Reports all problems
5763  to LOG_ERROR. The checks are not designed to be airtight (e.g., if you
5764  use 360 degrees instead of 0 we'll let it slide).
5765 
5766  Mild side effects may occur:
5767  Note that the units-to-level-units COMPAT114 trick is wedged in here.
5768 \*****************************************************************************/
5769 static NV_BOOL check_tide_record(TIDE_RECORD *rec) {
5770  NV_U_INT32 i;
5771  NV_BOOL ret = NVTrue;
5772 
5773  if (!rec) {
5774  LOG_ERROR("libtcd error: null pointer passed to check_tide_record\n");
5775  return NVFalse;
5776  }
5777 
5778  /* These are all static fields--if a buffer overflow has occurred on one
5779  of these, other fields might be invalid, but the problem started here. */
5780  boundscheck_oneliner(rec->header.name);
5781  boundscheck_oneliner(rec->source);
5782  boundscheck_monologue(rec->comments);
5783  boundscheck_monologue(rec->notes);
5784  boundscheck_oneliner(rec->station_id_context);
5785  boundscheck_oneliner(rec->station_id);
5786  boundscheck_monologue(rec->xfields);
5787 
5788 #ifdef COMPAT114
5789  if (rec->header.record_type == REFERENCE_STATION && rec->units > 0)
5790  rec->level_units = rec->units;
5791 #endif
5792 
5793  if (rec->header.latitude < -90.0 || rec->header.latitude > 90.0 ||
5794  rec->header.longitude < -180.0 || rec->header.longitude > 180.0) {
5795  LOG_ERROR("libtcd error: bad coordinates in tide record\n");
5796  ret = NVFalse;
5797  }
5798 
5799  if (rec->header.tzfile < 0 ||
5800  rec->header.tzfile >= (NV_INT32)hd.pub.tzfiles) {
5801  LOG_ERROR("libtcd error: bad tzfile in tide record\n");
5802  ret = NVFalse;
5803  }
5804 
5805  if (rec->header.name[0] == '\0') {
5806  LOG_ERROR("libtcd error: null name in tide record\n");
5807  ret = NVFalse;
5808  }
5809 
5810  if (rec->country < 0 || rec->country >= (NV_INT32)hd.pub.countries) {
5811  LOG_ERROR("libtcd error: bad country in tide record\n");
5812  ret = NVFalse;
5813  }
5814 
5815  if (rec->restriction >= hd.pub.restriction_types) {
5816  LOG_ERROR("libtcd error: bad restriction in tide record\n");
5817  ret = NVFalse;
5818  }
5819 
5820  if (rec->legalese >= hd.pub.legaleses) {
5821  LOG_ERROR("libtcd error: bad legalese in tide record\n");
5822  ret = NVFalse;
5823  }
5824 
5825  if (!check_date(rec->date_imported)) {
5826  LOG_ERROR("libtcd error: bad date_imported in tide record\n");
5827  ret = NVFalse;
5828  }
5829 
5830  if (rec->direction_units >= hd.pub.dir_unit_types) {
5831  LOG_ERROR("libtcd error: bad direction_units in tide record\n");
5832  ret = NVFalse;
5833  }
5834 
5835  if (rec->min_direction < 0 || rec->min_direction > 361) {
5836  LOG_ERROR("libtcd error: min_direction out of range in tide record\n");
5837  ret = NVFalse;
5838  }
5839 
5840  if (rec->max_direction < 0 || rec->max_direction > 361) {
5841  LOG_ERROR("libtcd error: max_direction out of range in tide record\n");
5842  ret = NVFalse;
5843  }
5844 
5845  if (rec->level_units >= hd.pub.level_unit_types) {
5846  LOG_ERROR("libtcd error: bad units in tide record\n");
5847  ret = NVFalse;
5848  }
5849 
5850  switch (rec->header.record_type) {
5851  case REFERENCE_STATION:
5852  if (rec->header.reference_station != -1) {
5853  LOG_ERROR("libtcd error: type 1 record, reference_station != -1\n");
5854  ret = NVFalse;
5855  }
5856 
5857  if (rec->datum_offset < -13421.7728 || rec->datum_offset > 13421.7727) {
5858  LOG_ERROR("libtcd error: datum_offset out of range in tide record\n");
5859  ret = NVFalse;
5860  }
5861 
5862  if (rec->datum < 0 || rec->datum >= (NV_INT32)hd.pub.datum_types) {
5863  LOG_ERROR("libtcd error: bad datum in tide record\n");
5864  ret = NVFalse;
5865  }
5866 
5867  if (rec->zone_offset < -4096 || rec->zone_offset > 4095 ||
5868  rec->zone_offset % 100 >= 60) {
5869  LOG_ERROR("libtcd error: bad zone_offset in tide record\n");
5870  ret = NVFalse;
5871  }
5872 
5873  if (!check_date(rec->expiration_date)) {
5874  LOG_ERROR("libtcd error: bad expiration_date in tide record\n");
5875  ret = NVFalse;
5876  }
5877 
5878  if (rec->months_on_station > 1023) {
5879  LOG_ERROR(
5880  "libtcd error: months_on_station out of range in tide record\n");
5881  ret = NVFalse;
5882  }
5883 
5884  if (!check_date(rec->last_date_on_station)) {
5885  LOG_ERROR("libtcd error: bad last_date_on_station in tide record\n");
5886  ret = NVFalse;
5887  }
5888 
5889  if (rec->confidence > 15) {
5890  LOG_ERROR("libtcd error: confidence out of range in tide record\n");
5891  ret = NVFalse;
5892  }
5893 
5894  /* Only issue each error once. */
5895  for (i = 0; i < hd.pub.constituents; ++i) {
5896  if (rec->amplitude[i] < 0.0 || rec->amplitude[i] > 52.4287) {
5897  LOG_ERROR(
5898  "libtcd error: constituent amplitude out of range in tide "
5899  "record\n");
5900  ret = NVFalse;
5901  break;
5902  }
5903  }
5904  for (i = 0; i < hd.pub.constituents; ++i) {
5905  if (rec->epoch[i] < 0.0 || rec->epoch[i] > 360.0) {
5906  LOG_ERROR(
5907  "libtcd error: constituent epoch out of range in tide record\n");
5908  ret = NVFalse;
5909  break;
5910  }
5911  }
5912 
5913  break;
5914 
5915  case SUBORDINATE_STATION:
5916  if (rec->header.reference_station < 0 ||
5917  rec->header.reference_station >= (NV_INT32)hd.pub.number_of_records) {
5918  LOG_ERROR("libtcd error: bad reference_station in tide record\n");
5919  ret = NVFalse;
5920  }
5921 
5922  if (rec->min_time_add < -4096 || rec->min_time_add > 4095 ||
5923  rec->min_time_add % 100 >= 60) {
5924  LOG_ERROR("libtcd error: bad min_time_add in tide record\n");
5925  ret = NVFalse;
5926  }
5927 
5928  if (rec->min_level_add < -65.536 || rec->min_level_add > 65.535) {
5929  LOG_ERROR("libtcd error: min_level_add out of range in tide record\n");
5930  ret = NVFalse;
5931  }
5932 
5933  if (rec->min_level_multiply < 0.0 || rec->min_level_multiply > 65.535) {
5934  LOG_ERROR(
5935  "libtcd error: min_level_multiply out of range in tide record\n");
5936  ret = NVFalse;
5937  }
5938 
5939  if (rec->max_time_add < -4096 || rec->max_time_add > 4095 ||
5940  rec->max_time_add % 100 >= 60) {
5941  LOG_ERROR("libtcd error: bad max_time_add in tide record\n");
5942  ret = NVFalse;
5943  }
5944 
5945  if (rec->max_level_add < -65.536 || rec->max_level_add > 65.535) {
5946  LOG_ERROR("libtcd error: max_level_add out of range in tide record\n");
5947  ret = NVFalse;
5948  }
5949 
5950  if (rec->max_level_multiply < 0.0 || rec->max_level_multiply > 65.535) {
5951  LOG_ERROR(
5952  "libtcd error: max_level_multiply out of range in tide record\n");
5953  ret = NVFalse;
5954  }
5955 
5956  if (rec->flood_begins != NULLSLACKOFFSET &&
5957  (rec->flood_begins < -4096 || rec->flood_begins > 4095 ||
5958  rec->flood_begins % 100 >= 60)) {
5959  LOG_ERROR("libtcd error: bad flood_begins in tide record\n");
5960  ret = NVFalse;
5961  }
5962 
5963  if (rec->ebb_begins != NULLSLACKOFFSET &&
5964  (rec->ebb_begins < -4096 || rec->ebb_begins > 4095 ||
5965  rec->ebb_begins % 100 >= 60)) {
5966  LOG_ERROR("libtcd error: bad ebb_begins in tide record\n");
5967  ret = NVFalse;
5968  }
5969 
5970  break;
5971 
5972  default:
5973  LOG_ERROR("libtcd error: invalid record_type in tide record\n");
5974  ret = NVFalse;
5975  }
5976 
5977  if (ret == NVFalse) dump_tide_record(rec);
5978  return ret;
5979 }
5980 
5981 /*****************************************************************************\
5982  DWF 2004-10-13
5983  Calculate size of a tide record as it would be encoded in the TCD file.
5984  Size is stored in record_size field. Return is number of constituents
5985  that will be encoded.
5986 \*****************************************************************************/
5987 static NV_U_INT32 figure_size(TIDE_RECORD *rec) {
5988  NV_U_INT32 i, count = 0, name_size, source_size, comments_size, notes_size,
5989  station_id_context_size, station_id_size, xfields_size;
5990 
5991  assert(rec);
5992 
5993  /* Figure out how many bits we'll need for this record. */
5994 
5995  name_size = strlen(clip_string(rec->header.name)) + 1;
5996  source_size = strlen(clip_string(rec->source)) + 1;
5997  comments_size = strlen(clip_string(rec->comments)) + 1;
5998  notes_size = strlen(clip_string(rec->notes)) + 1;
5999  station_id_context_size = strlen(clip_string(rec->station_id_context)) + 1;
6000  station_id_size = strlen(clip_string(rec->station_id)) + 1;
6001  /* No clipping on xfields -- trailing \n required by syntax */
6002  xfields_size = strlen(rec->xfields) + 1;
6003 
6004  rec->header.record_size =
6005  hd.record_size_bits + hd.record_type_bits + hd.latitude_bits +
6006  hd.longitude_bits + hd.station_bits + hd.tzfile_bits + (name_size * 8) +
6007 
6008  hd.country_bits + (source_size * 8) + hd.restriction_bits +
6009  (comments_size * 8) + (notes_size * 8) + hd.legalese_bits +
6010  (station_id_context_size * 8) + (station_id_size * 8) + hd.date_bits +
6011  (xfields_size * 8) + hd.dir_unit_bits + hd.direction_bits +
6012  hd.direction_bits + hd.level_unit_bits;
6013 
6014  switch (rec->header.record_type) {
6015  case REFERENCE_STATION:
6016  rec->header.record_size += hd.datum_offset_bits + hd.datum_bits +
6017  hd.time_bits + hd.date_bits +
6018  hd.months_on_station_bits + hd.date_bits +
6019  hd.confidence_value_bits + hd.constituent_bits;
6020 
6021  for (i = 0; i < hd.pub.constituents; ++i) {
6022  assert(rec->amplitude[i] >= 0.0);
6023  if (rec->amplitude[i] >= AMPLITUDE_EPSILON) ++count;
6024  }
6025 
6026  rec->header.record_size +=
6027  (count * hd.constituent_bits + count * hd.amplitude_bits +
6028  count * hd.epoch_bits);
6029 
6030  break;
6031 
6032  case SUBORDINATE_STATION:
6033  rec->header.record_size += hd.time_bits + hd.level_add_bits +
6034  hd.level_multiply_bits + hd.time_bits +
6035  hd.level_add_bits + hd.level_multiply_bits +
6036  hd.time_bits + hd.time_bits;
6037  break;
6038 
6039  default:
6040  assert(0);
6041  }
6042 
6043  rec->header.record_size = bits2bytes(rec->header.record_size);
6044  return count;
6045 }
6046 
6047 /*****************************************************************************\
6048 DWF 2004-10-14
6049 \*****************************************************************************/
6050 static void pack_string(NV_U_BYTE *buf, NV_U_INT32 *pos, NV_CHAR *s) {
6051  NV_U_INT32 i, temp_size;
6052  assert(buf);
6053  assert(pos);
6054  assert(s);
6055  temp_size = strlen(s) + 1;
6056  for (i = 0; i < temp_size; ++i) {
6057  bit_pack(buf, *pos, 8, s[i]);
6058  *pos += 8;
6059  }
6060 }
6061 
6062 /*****************************************************************************\
6063 
6064  Function pack_tide_record - convert TIDE_RECORD to packed form
6065 
6066  Synopsis pack_tide_record (rec, bufptr, bufsize);
6067 
6068  TIDE_RECORD *rec tide record (in)
6069  NV_U_BYTE **bufptr packed record (out)
6070  NV_U_INT32 *bufsize size of buf in bytes (out)
6071 
6072  buf is allocated by pack_tide_record and should be
6073  freed by the caller.
6074 
6075  Returns void
6076 
6077  Author Extracted from write_tide_record by David Flater
6078  Date 2006-05-26
6079 
6080 \*****************************************************************************/
6081 
6082 static void pack_tide_record(TIDE_RECORD *rec, NV_U_BYTE **bufptr,
6083  NV_U_INT32 *bufsize) {
6084  NV_U_INT32 i, pos, constituent_count;
6085  NV_INT32 temp_int;
6086  NV_U_BYTE *buf;
6087 
6088  /* Validate input */
6089  assert(rec);
6090  /* Cursory check for buffer overflows. Should not happen here --
6091  check_tide_record does a more thorough job when called by add_tide_record
6092  and update_tide_record. */
6093  boundscheck_oneliner(rec->header.name);
6094  boundscheck_oneliner(rec->source);
6095  boundscheck_monologue(rec->comments);
6096  boundscheck_monologue(rec->notes);
6097  boundscheck_oneliner(rec->station_id_context);
6098  boundscheck_oneliner(rec->station_id);
6099  boundscheck_monologue(rec->xfields);
6100 
6101  constituent_count = figure_size(rec);
6102 
6103  if (!(*bufptr =
6104  (NV_U_BYTE *)calloc(rec->header.record_size, sizeof(NV_U_BYTE)))) {
6105  perror("libtcd can't allocate memory in pack_tide_record");
6106  exit(-1);
6107  }
6108  buf = *bufptr; /* To conserve asterisks */
6109 
6110  /* Bit pack the common section. "pos" is the bit position within the
6111  buffer "buf". */
6112 
6113  pos = 0;
6114 
6115  bit_pack(buf, pos, hd.record_size_bits, rec->header.record_size);
6116  pos += hd.record_size_bits;
6117 
6118  bit_pack(buf, pos, hd.record_type_bits, rec->header.record_type);
6119  pos += hd.record_type_bits;
6120 
6121  temp_int = NINT(rec->header.latitude * hd.latitude_scale);
6122  bit_pack(buf, pos, hd.latitude_bits, temp_int);
6123  pos += hd.latitude_bits;
6124 
6125  temp_int = NINT(rec->header.longitude * hd.longitude_scale);
6126  bit_pack(buf, pos, hd.longitude_bits, temp_int);
6127  pos += hd.longitude_bits;
6128 
6129  /* This ordering doesn't match everywhere else but there's no technical
6130  reason to change it from its V1 ordering. To do so would force
6131  another conditional in unpack_partial_tide_record. */
6132 
6133  bit_pack(buf, pos, hd.tzfile_bits, rec->header.tzfile);
6134  pos += hd.tzfile_bits;
6135 
6136  pack_string(buf, &pos, clip_string(rec->header.name));
6137 
6138  bit_pack(buf, pos, hd.station_bits, rec->header.reference_station);
6139  pos += hd.station_bits;
6140 
6141  bit_pack(buf, pos, hd.country_bits, rec->country);
6142  pos += hd.country_bits;
6143 
6144  pack_string(buf, &pos, clip_string(rec->source));
6145 
6146  bit_pack(buf, pos, hd.restriction_bits, rec->restriction);
6147  pos += hd.restriction_bits;
6148 
6149  pack_string(buf, &pos, clip_string(rec->comments));
6150  pack_string(buf, &pos, clip_string(rec->notes));
6151 
6152  bit_pack(buf, pos, hd.legalese_bits, rec->legalese);
6153  pos += hd.legalese_bits;
6154 
6155  pack_string(buf, &pos, clip_string(rec->station_id_context));
6156  pack_string(buf, &pos, clip_string(rec->station_id));
6157 
6158  bit_pack(buf, pos, hd.date_bits, rec->date_imported);
6159  pos += hd.date_bits;
6160 
6161  /* No clipping on xfields -- trailing \n required by syntax */
6162  pack_string(buf, &pos, rec->xfields);
6163 
6164  bit_pack(buf, pos, hd.dir_unit_bits, rec->direction_units);
6165  pos += hd.dir_unit_bits;
6166 
6167  bit_pack(buf, pos, hd.direction_bits, rec->min_direction);
6168  pos += hd.direction_bits;
6169 
6170  bit_pack(buf, pos, hd.direction_bits, rec->max_direction);
6171  pos += hd.direction_bits;
6172 
6173  /* The units-to-level-units compatibility hack is in check_tide_record */
6174  bit_pack(buf, pos, hd.level_unit_bits, rec->level_units);
6175  pos += hd.level_unit_bits;
6176 
6177  /* Bit pack record type 1 records. */
6178 
6179  if (rec->header.record_type == REFERENCE_STATION) {
6180  temp_int = NINT(rec->datum_offset * hd.datum_offset_scale);
6181  bit_pack(buf, pos, hd.datum_offset_bits, temp_int);
6182  pos += hd.datum_offset_bits;
6183 
6184  bit_pack(buf, pos, hd.datum_bits, rec->datum);
6185  pos += hd.datum_bits;
6186 
6187  bit_pack(buf, pos, hd.time_bits, rec->zone_offset);
6188  pos += hd.time_bits;
6189 
6190  bit_pack(buf, pos, hd.date_bits, rec->expiration_date);
6191  pos += hd.date_bits;
6192 
6193  bit_pack(buf, pos, hd.months_on_station_bits, rec->months_on_station);
6194  pos += hd.months_on_station_bits;
6195 
6196  bit_pack(buf, pos, hd.date_bits, rec->last_date_on_station);
6197  pos += hd.date_bits;
6198 
6199  bit_pack(buf, pos, hd.confidence_value_bits, rec->confidence);
6200  pos += hd.confidence_value_bits;
6201 
6202  bit_pack(buf, pos, hd.constituent_bits, constituent_count);
6203  pos += hd.constituent_bits;
6204 
6205  for (i = 0; i < hd.pub.constituents; ++i) {
6206  if (rec->amplitude[i] >= AMPLITUDE_EPSILON) {
6207  bit_pack(buf, pos, hd.constituent_bits, i);
6208  pos += hd.constituent_bits;
6209 
6210  temp_int = NINT(rec->amplitude[i] * hd.amplitude_scale);
6211  assert(temp_int);
6212  bit_pack(buf, pos, hd.amplitude_bits, temp_int);
6213  pos += hd.amplitude_bits;
6214 
6215  temp_int = NINT(rec->epoch[i] * hd.epoch_scale);
6216  bit_pack(buf, pos, hd.epoch_bits, temp_int);
6217  pos += hd.epoch_bits;
6218  }
6219  }
6220  }
6221 
6222  /* Bit pack record type 2 records. */
6223  else if (rec->header.record_type == SUBORDINATE_STATION) {
6224  bit_pack(buf, pos, hd.time_bits, rec->min_time_add);
6225  pos += hd.time_bits;
6226 
6227  temp_int = NINT(rec->min_level_add * hd.level_add_scale);
6228  bit_pack(buf, pos, hd.level_add_bits, temp_int);
6229  pos += hd.level_add_bits;
6230 
6231  temp_int = NINT(rec->min_level_multiply * hd.level_multiply_scale);
6232  bit_pack(buf, pos, hd.level_multiply_bits, temp_int);
6233  pos += hd.level_multiply_bits;
6234 
6235  bit_pack(buf, pos, hd.time_bits, rec->max_time_add);
6236  pos += hd.time_bits;
6237 
6238  temp_int = NINT(rec->max_level_add * hd.level_add_scale);
6239  bit_pack(buf, pos, hd.level_add_bits, temp_int);
6240  pos += hd.level_add_bits;
6241 
6242  temp_int = NINT(rec->max_level_multiply * hd.level_multiply_scale);
6243  bit_pack(buf, pos, hd.level_multiply_bits, temp_int);
6244  pos += hd.level_multiply_bits;
6245 
6246  bit_pack(buf, pos, hd.time_bits, rec->flood_begins);
6247  pos += hd.time_bits;
6248 
6249  bit_pack(buf, pos, hd.time_bits, rec->ebb_begins);
6250  pos += hd.time_bits;
6251  }
6252 
6253  else {
6254  LOG_ERROR("libtcd error: Record type %d is undefined\n",
6255  rec->header.record_type);
6256  exit(-1);
6257  }
6258 
6259  *bufsize = rec->header.record_size;
6260  assert(*bufsize == bits2bytes(pos));
6261 }
6262 
6263 /*****************************************************************************\
6264 
6265  Function write_tide_record - writes a tide record to the database
6266 
6267  Synopsis write_tide_record (num, rec);
6268 
6269  NV_INT32 num record number:
6270  >= 0 overwrite record num
6271  -1 write at current file position
6272  TIDE_RECORD *rec tide record
6273 
6274  Returns NV_BOOL NVTrue if successful
6275 
6276  Author Jan C. Depner
6277  Date 08/01/02
6278 
6279  See libtcd.html for changelog.
6280 
6281  hd.end_of_file is not updated by this function in any event.
6282 
6283 \*****************************************************************************/
6284 
6285 static NV_BOOL write_tide_record(NV_INT32 num, TIDE_RECORD *rec) {
6286  NV_U_BYTE *buf = NULL;
6287  NV_U_INT32 bufsize = 0;
6288 
6289  if (!fp) {
6290  LOG_ERROR(
6291  "libtcd error: attempt to access database when database not open\n");
6292  return NVFalse;
6293  }
6294  write_protect();
6295 
6296  pack_tide_record(rec, &buf, &bufsize);
6297 
6298  if (num == -1)
6299  ;
6300  else if (num >= 0)
6301  fseek(fp, tindex[num].address, SEEK_SET);
6302  else
6303  assert(0);
6304 
6305  chk_fwrite(buf, bufsize, 1, fp);
6306  free(buf);
6307  modified = NVTrue;
6308  return NVTrue;
6309 }
6310 
6311 /*****************************************************************************\
6312 
6313  Function read_next_tide_record - reads the next tide record from
6314  the database
6315 
6316  Synopsis read_next_tide_record (rec);
6317 
6318  TIDE_RECORD *rec tide record
6319 
6320  Returns NV_INT32 record number of the tide record
6321 
6322  Author Jan C. Depner
6323  Date 08/01/02
6324 
6325  See libtcd.html for changelog.
6326 
6327 \*****************************************************************************/
6328 
6329 NV_INT32 read_next_tide_record(TIDE_RECORD *rec) {
6330  return (read_tide_record(current_record + 1, rec));
6331 }
6332 
6333 /*****************************************************************************\
6334 
6335  Function unpack_tide_record - convert TIDE_RECORD from packed form
6336 
6337  Synopsis unpack_tide_record (buf, bufsize, rec);
6338 
6339  NV_U_BYTE *buf packed record (in)
6340  NV_U_INT32 bufsize size of buf in bytes (in)
6341  TIDE_RECORD *rec tide record (in-out)
6342 
6343  rec must be allocated by the caller.
6344 
6345  Returns void
6346 
6347  Author Extracted from read_tide_record by David Flater
6348  Date 2006-05-26
6349 
6350  rec->header.record_number is initialized from the global current_record.
6351 
6352 \*****************************************************************************/
6353 
6354 static void unpack_tide_record(NV_U_BYTE *buf, NV_U_INT32 bufsize,
6355  TIDE_RECORD *rec) {
6356  NV_INT32 temp_int;
6357  NV_U_INT32 i, j, pos, count;
6358 
6359  assert(rec);
6360 
6361  /* Initialize record */
6362  memset(rec, 0, sizeof(TIDE_RECORD));
6363  {
6364  int r = find_dir_units("degrees true");
6365  assert(r > 0);
6366  rec->direction_units = (NV_U_BYTE)r;
6367  }
6368  rec->min_direction = rec->max_direction = 361;
6369  rec->flood_begins = rec->ebb_begins = NULLSLACKOFFSET;
6370  rec->header.record_number = current_record;
6371 
6372  unpack_partial_tide_record(buf, bufsize, rec, &pos);
6373 
6374  switch (rec->header.record_type) {
6375  case REFERENCE_STATION:
6376  case SUBORDINATE_STATION:
6377  break;
6378  default:
6379  LOG_ERROR("libtcd fatal error: tried to read type %d tide record.\n",
6380  rec->header.record_type);
6381  LOG_ERROR(
6382  "This version of libtcd only supports types 1 and 2. Perhaps you "
6383  "should\nupgrade.\n");
6384  exit(-1);
6385  }
6386 
6387  switch (hd.pub.major_rev) {
6388  /************************* TCD V1 *****************************/
6389  case 0:
6390  case 1:
6391 
6392  /* "pos" is the bit position within the buffer "buf". */
6393 
6394  rec->country = bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.country_bits);
6395  pos += hd.country_bits;
6396 
6397  /* pedigree */
6398  pos += hd.pedigree_bits;
6399 
6400  unpack_string(buf, bufsize, &pos, rec->source, ONELINER_LENGTH,
6401  "source field");
6402 
6403  rec->restriction = bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.restriction_bits);
6404  pos += hd.restriction_bits;
6405 
6406  unpack_string(buf, bufsize, &pos, rec->comments, MONOLOGUE_LENGTH,
6407  "comments field");
6408 
6409  if (rec->header.record_type == REFERENCE_STATION) {
6410  rec->level_units = bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.level_unit_bits);
6411 #ifdef COMPAT114
6412  rec->units = rec->level_units;
6413 #endif
6414  pos += hd.level_unit_bits;
6415 
6416  temp_int = signed_bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.datum_offset_bits);
6417  rec->datum_offset = (NV_FLOAT32)temp_int / hd.datum_offset_scale;
6418  pos += hd.datum_offset_bits;
6419 
6420  rec->datum = bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.datum_bits);
6421  pos += hd.datum_bits;
6422 
6423  rec->zone_offset = signed_bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.time_bits);
6424  pos += hd.time_bits;
6425 
6426  rec->expiration_date = bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.date_bits);
6427  pos += hd.date_bits;
6428 
6429  rec->months_on_station =
6430  bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.months_on_station_bits);
6431  pos += hd.months_on_station_bits;
6432 
6433  rec->last_date_on_station = bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.date_bits);
6434  pos += hd.date_bits;
6435 
6436  rec->confidence = bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.confidence_value_bits);
6437  pos += hd.confidence_value_bits;
6438 
6439  for (i = 0; i < hd.pub.constituents; ++i) {
6440  rec->amplitude[i] = 0.0;
6441  rec->epoch[i] = 0.0;
6442  }
6443 
6444  count = bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.constituent_bits);
6445  pos += hd.constituent_bits;
6446 
6447  for (i = 0; i < count; ++i) {
6448  j = bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.constituent_bits);
6449  pos += hd.constituent_bits;
6450 
6451  rec->amplitude[j] =
6452  (NV_FLOAT32)bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.amplitude_bits) /
6453  hd.amplitude_scale;
6454  pos += hd.amplitude_bits;
6455 
6456  rec->epoch[j] =
6457  (NV_FLOAT32)bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.epoch_bits) / hd.epoch_scale;
6458  pos += hd.epoch_bits;
6459  }
6460  } else if (rec->header.record_type == SUBORDINATE_STATION) {
6461  rec->level_units = bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.level_unit_bits);
6462  pos += hd.level_unit_bits;
6463 
6464  rec->direction_units = bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.dir_unit_bits);
6465  pos += hd.dir_unit_bits;
6466 
6467  /* avg_level_units */
6468  pos += hd.level_unit_bits;
6469 
6470  rec->min_time_add = signed_bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.time_bits);
6471  pos += hd.time_bits;
6472 
6473  temp_int = signed_bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.level_add_bits);
6474  rec->min_level_add = (NV_FLOAT32)temp_int / hd.level_add_scale;
6475  pos += hd.level_add_bits;
6476 
6477  /* Signed in V1 */
6478  temp_int = signed_bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.level_multiply_bits);
6479  rec->min_level_multiply =
6480  (NV_FLOAT32)temp_int / hd.level_multiply_scale;
6481  pos += hd.level_multiply_bits;
6482 
6483  /* min_avg_level */
6484  pos += hd.level_add_bits;
6485 
6486  rec->min_direction = bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.direction_bits);
6487  pos += hd.direction_bits;
6488 
6489  rec->max_time_add = signed_bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.time_bits);
6490  pos += hd.time_bits;
6491 
6492  temp_int = signed_bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.level_add_bits);
6493  rec->max_level_add = (NV_FLOAT32)temp_int / hd.level_add_scale;
6494  pos += hd.level_add_bits;
6495 
6496  /* Signed in V1 */
6497  temp_int = signed_bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.level_multiply_bits);
6498  rec->max_level_multiply =
6499  (NV_FLOAT32)temp_int / hd.level_multiply_scale;
6500  pos += hd.level_multiply_bits;
6501 
6502  /* max_avg_level */
6503  pos += hd.level_add_bits;
6504 
6505  rec->max_direction = bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.direction_bits);
6506  pos += hd.direction_bits;
6507 
6508  rec->flood_begins = signed_bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.time_bits);
6509  pos += hd.time_bits;
6510 
6511  rec->ebb_begins = signed_bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.time_bits);
6512  pos += hd.time_bits;
6513  } else {
6514  assert(0);
6515  }
6516  break;
6517 
6518  /************************* TCD V2 *****************************/
6519  case 2:
6520  rec->country = bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.country_bits);
6521  pos += hd.country_bits;
6522 
6523  unpack_string(buf, bufsize, &pos, rec->source, ONELINER_LENGTH,
6524  "source field");
6525 
6526  rec->restriction = bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.restriction_bits);
6527  pos += hd.restriction_bits;
6528 
6529  unpack_string(buf, bufsize, &pos, rec->comments, MONOLOGUE_LENGTH,
6530  "comments field");
6531  unpack_string(buf, bufsize, &pos, rec->notes, MONOLOGUE_LENGTH,
6532  "notes field");
6533 
6534  rec->legalese = bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.legalese_bits);
6535  pos += hd.legalese_bits;
6536 
6537  unpack_string(buf, bufsize, &pos, rec->station_id_context,
6538  ONELINER_LENGTH, "station_id_context field");
6539  unpack_string(buf, bufsize, &pos, rec->station_id, ONELINER_LENGTH,
6540  "station_id field");
6541 
6542  rec->date_imported = bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.date_bits);
6543  pos += hd.date_bits;
6544 
6545  unpack_string(buf, bufsize, &pos, rec->xfields, MONOLOGUE_LENGTH,
6546  "xfields field");
6547 
6548  rec->direction_units = bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.dir_unit_bits);
6549  pos += hd.dir_unit_bits;
6550 
6551  rec->min_direction = bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.direction_bits);
6552  pos += hd.direction_bits;
6553 
6554  rec->max_direction = bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.direction_bits);
6555  pos += hd.direction_bits;
6556 
6557  rec->level_units = bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.level_unit_bits);
6558 #ifdef COMPAT114
6559  rec->units = rec->level_units;
6560 #endif
6561  pos += hd.level_unit_bits;
6562 
6563  if (rec->header.record_type == REFERENCE_STATION) {
6564  temp_int = signed_bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.datum_offset_bits);
6565  rec->datum_offset = (NV_FLOAT32)temp_int / hd.datum_offset_scale;
6566  pos += hd.datum_offset_bits;
6567 
6568  rec->datum = bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.datum_bits);
6569  pos += hd.datum_bits;
6570 
6571  rec->zone_offset = signed_bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.time_bits);
6572  pos += hd.time_bits;
6573 
6574  rec->expiration_date = bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.date_bits);
6575  pos += hd.date_bits;
6576 
6577  rec->months_on_station =
6578  bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.months_on_station_bits);
6579  pos += hd.months_on_station_bits;
6580 
6581  rec->last_date_on_station = bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.date_bits);
6582  pos += hd.date_bits;
6583 
6584  rec->confidence = bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.confidence_value_bits);
6585  pos += hd.confidence_value_bits;
6586 
6587  for (i = 0; i < hd.pub.constituents; ++i) {
6588  rec->amplitude[i] = 0.0;
6589  rec->epoch[i] = 0.0;
6590  }
6591 
6592  count = bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.constituent_bits);
6593  pos += hd.constituent_bits;
6594 
6595  for (i = 0; i < count; ++i) {
6596  j = bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.constituent_bits);
6597  pos += hd.constituent_bits;
6598 
6599  rec->amplitude[j] =
6600  (NV_FLOAT32)bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.amplitude_bits) /
6601  hd.amplitude_scale;
6602  pos += hd.amplitude_bits;
6603 
6604  rec->epoch[j] =
6605  (NV_FLOAT32)bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.epoch_bits) / hd.epoch_scale;
6606  pos += hd.epoch_bits;
6607  }
6608  } else if (rec->header.record_type == SUBORDINATE_STATION) {
6609  rec->min_time_add = signed_bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.time_bits);
6610  pos += hd.time_bits;
6611 
6612  temp_int = signed_bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.level_add_bits);
6613  rec->min_level_add = (NV_FLOAT32)temp_int / hd.level_add_scale;
6614  pos += hd.level_add_bits;
6615 
6616  /* Made unsigned in V2 */
6617  temp_int = bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.level_multiply_bits);
6618  rec->min_level_multiply =
6619  (NV_FLOAT32)temp_int / hd.level_multiply_scale;
6620  pos += hd.level_multiply_bits;
6621 
6622  rec->max_time_add = signed_bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.time_bits);
6623  pos += hd.time_bits;
6624 
6625  temp_int = signed_bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.level_add_bits);
6626  rec->max_level_add = (NV_FLOAT32)temp_int / hd.level_add_scale;
6627  pos += hd.level_add_bits;
6628 
6629  /* Made unsigned in V2 */
6630  temp_int = bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.level_multiply_bits);
6631  rec->max_level_multiply =
6632  (NV_FLOAT32)temp_int / hd.level_multiply_scale;
6633  pos += hd.level_multiply_bits;
6634 
6635  rec->flood_begins = signed_bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.time_bits);
6636  pos += hd.time_bits;
6637 
6638  rec->ebb_begins = signed_bit_unpack(buf, pos, hd.time_bits);
6639  pos += hd.time_bits;
6640  } else {
6641  assert(0);
6642  }
6643  break;
6644 
6645  default:
6646  assert(0);
6647  }
6648 
6649  assert(pos <= bufsize * 8);
6650 }
6651 
6652 /*****************************************************************************\
6653 
6654  Function read_tide_record - reads tide record "num" from the
6655  database
6656 
6657  Synopsis read_tide_record (num, rec);
6658 
6659  NV_INT32 num record number (in)
6660  TIDE_RECORD *rec tide record (in-out)
6661 
6662  rec must be allocated by the caller.
6663 
6664  Returns NV_INT32 num if success, -1 if failure
6665 
6666  Author Jan C. Depner
6667  Date 08/01/02
6668 
6669  See libtcd.html for changelog.
6670 
6671 \*****************************************************************************/
6672 
6673 NV_INT32 read_tide_record(NV_INT32 num, TIDE_RECORD *rec) {
6674  NV_U_BYTE *buf;
6675  NV_U_INT32 bufsize;
6676 
6677  if (!fp) {
6678  LOG_ERROR(
6679  "libtcd error: attempt to access database when database not open\n");
6680  return -1;
6681  }
6682 
6683  if (num < 0 || num >= (NV_INT32)hd.pub.number_of_records) return -1;
6684  assert(rec);
6685 
6686  bufsize = tindex[num].record_size;
6687  if ((buf = (NV_U_BYTE *)calloc(bufsize, sizeof(NV_U_BYTE))) == NULL) {
6688  perror("Allocating read_tide_record buffer");
6689  exit(-1);
6690  }
6691 
6692  current_record = num;
6693  require(fseek(fp, tindex[num].address, SEEK_SET) == 0);
6694  chk_fread(buf, tindex[num].record_size, 1, fp);
6695  unpack_tide_record(buf, bufsize, rec);
6696  free(buf);
6697  return num;
6698 }

6703 
6704  Synopsis add_tide_record (rec);
6705 
6706  TIDE_RECORD *rec tide record
6707 
6708  Returns NV_BOOL NVTrue if successful

6717 NV_BOOL add_tide_record(TIDE_RECORD *rec, DB_HEADER_PUBLIC *db) {
6718  NV_INT32 pos;
6719 
6720  if (!fp) {
6721  LOG_ERROR(
6722  "libtcd error: attempt to access database when database not open\n");
6723  return NVFalse;
6724  }
6725  write_protect();
6726 
6727  if (!check_tide_record(rec)) return NVFalse;
6728 
6729  fseek(fp, hd.end_of_file, SEEK_SET);
6730  pos = ftell(fp);
6731  assert(pos > 0);
6732 
6733  rec->header.record_number = hd.pub.number_of_records++;
6734 
6735  if (write_tide_record(-1, rec)) {
6736  if ((tindex = (TIDE_INDEX *)realloc(
6737  tindex, hd.pub.number_of_records * sizeof(TIDE_INDEX))) == NULL) {
6738  perror("Allocating more index records");
6739  exit(-1);
6740  }
6741 
6742  tindex[rec->header.record_number].address = pos;
6743  tindex[rec->header.record_number].record_size = rec->header.record_size;
6744  tindex[rec->header.record_number].record_type = rec->header.record_type;
6745  tindex[rec->header.record_number].reference_station =
6746  rec->header.reference_station;
6747  assert(rec->header.tzfile >= 0);
6748  tindex[rec->header.record_number].tzfile = rec->header.tzfile;
6749  tindex[rec->header.record_number].lat =
6750  NINT(rec->header.latitude * hd.latitude_scale);
6751  tindex[rec->header.record_number].lon =
6752  NINT(rec->header.longitude * hd.longitude_scale);
6753 
6754  if ((tindex[rec->header.record_number].name = (NV_CHAR *)calloc(
6755  strlen(rec->header.name) + 1, sizeof(NV_CHAR))) == NULL) {
6756  perror("Allocating index name memory");
6757  exit(-1);
6758  }
6759 
6760  strcpy(tindex[rec->header.record_number].name, rec->header.name);
6761  pos = ftell(fp);
6762  assert(pos > 0);
6763  hd.end_of_file = pos;
6764  modified = NVTrue;
6765 
6766  /* Get the new number of records. */
6767  if (db) *db = hd.pub;
6768 
6769  return NVTrue;
6770  }
6771 
6772  return NVFalse;
6773 }

6775 #if 0
6776 /*****************************************************************************\
6777 
6778  Function delete_tide_record - deletes a record and all subordinate
6779  records from the database
6780 
6781  Synopsis delete_tide_record (num);
6782 
6783  NV_INT32 num record number
6784 
6785  Returns NV_BOOL NVTrue if successful
6786

6790  See libtcd.html for changelog.

6794 NV_BOOL delete_tide_record (NV_INT32 num, DB_HEADER_PUBLIC *db)
6795 {
6796  NV_INT32 i, newrecnum, *map;
6797  NV_U_BYTE **allrecs_packed;
6798 
6799  if (!fp) {
6800  LOG_ERROR ("libtcd error: attempt to access database when database not open\n");
6801  return NVFalse;
6802  }
6803  write_protect();
6804 
6805  if (num < 0 || num >= (NV_INT32)hd.pub.number_of_records) return NVFalse;
6806 
6807  /* Allocate workspace */
6808 
6809  if (!(map = (NV_INT32 *) malloc (hd.pub.number_of_records * sizeof(NV_INT32)))) {
6810  perror ("libtcd: delete_tide_record: can't malloc");
6811  return NVFalse;
6812  }
6813  if (!(allrecs_packed = (NV_U_BYTE **) malloc (hd.pub.number_of_records * sizeof(NV_U_BYTE*)))) {
6814  perror ("libtcd: delete_tide_record: can't malloc");
6815  free (map);
6816  return NVFalse;
6817  }
6818 
6819  /* First pass: read in database, build record number map and mark records
6820  for deletion */
6821 
6822  require (fseek (fp, tindex[0].address, SEEK_SET) == 0);
6823  for (newrecnum=0,i=0; i<(NV_INT32)hd.pub.number_of_records; ++i) {
6824  assert (ftell(fp) == tindex[i].address);
6825  if (i == num || (tindex[i].record_type == SUBORDINATE_STATION && tindex[i].reference_station == num)) {
6826  map[i] = -1;
6827  allrecs_packed[i] = NULL;
6828  require (fseek (fp, tindex[i].record_size, SEEK_CUR) == 0);
6829  } else {
6830  map[i] = newrecnum++;
6831  if (!(allrecs_packed[i] = (NV_U_BYTE *) malloc (tindex[i].record_size))) {
6832  perror ("libtcd: delete_tide_record: can't malloc");
6833  for (--i; i>=0; --i)
6834  free (allrecs_packed[i]);
6835  free (allrecs_packed);
6836  free (map);
6837  return NVFalse;
6838  }
6839  chk_fread (allrecs_packed[i], tindex[i].record_size, 1, fp);
6840  }
6841  }
6842 
6843  /* Second pass: rewrite database and fix substation linkage */
6844 
6845  require (fseek (fp, tindex[0].address, SEEK_SET) == 0);
6846  require (ftruncate (fileno(fp), tindex[0].address) == 0);
6847 
6848  for (i=0; i<(NV_INT32)hd.pub.number_of_records; ++i)
6849  if (map[i] >= 0) {
6850  if (tindex[i].record_type == SUBORDINATE_STATION) {
6851  assert (tindex[i].reference_station >= 0);
6852  assert (tindex[i].reference_station <= (NV_INT32)hd.pub.number_of_records);
6853  if (map[tindex[i].reference_station] != tindex[i].reference_station) {
6854  /* Fix broken reference station linkage */
6855  TIDE_RECORD rec;
6856  unpack_tide_record (allrecs_packed[i], tindex[i].record_size, &rec);
6857  free (allrecs_packed[i]);
6858  rec.header.reference_station = map[tindex[i].reference_station];
6859  pack_tide_record (&rec, &(allrecs_packed[i]), &(tindex[i].record_size));
6860  }
6861  }
6862  chk_fwrite (allrecs_packed[i], tindex[i].record_size, 1, fp);
6863  free (allrecs_packed[i]);
6864  }
6865 
6866  /* Free workspace (packed records were freed above) */
6867 
6868  free (allrecs_packed);
6869  free (map);
6870 
6871  /* Flush, reopen, renew. The index is now garbage; close and reopen
6872  to reindex. */
6873 
6874  hd.end_of_file = ftell(fp);
6875  hd.pub.number_of_records = newrecnum;
6876  modified = NVTrue;
6877  close_tide_db ();
6878  open_tide_db (filename);
6879 
6880  if (db)
6881  *db = hd.pub;
6882 
6883  return NVTrue;
6884 }
6885 
6886 #endif

6888 /*****************************************************************************\
6889 
6890  Function update_tide_record - updates a tide record in the database
6891 
6892  Synopsis update_tide_record (num, rec);
6893 
6894  NV_INT32 num record number
6895  TIDE_RECORD *rec tide record
6896 
6897  Returns NV_BOOL NVTrue if successful

6900  Date 08/01/02
