6905 
6906 #ifdef COMPAT114
6907 NV_BOOL update_tide_record(NV_INT32 num, TIDE_RECORD *rec)
6908 #else
6909 NV_BOOL update_tide_record(NV_INT32 num, TIDE_RECORD *rec, DB_HEADER_PUBLIC *db)
6910 #endif
6911 {
6912  NV_INT32 pos, size;
6913  TIDE_RECORD tmp_rec;
6914  NV_U_BYTE *block = NULL;
6915 
6916  if (!fp) {
6917  LOG_ERROR(
6918  "libtcd error: attempt to access database when database not open\n");
6919  return NVFalse;
6920  }
6921  write_protect();
6922 
6923  if (num < 0 || num >= (NV_INT32)hd.pub.number_of_records) return NVFalse;
6924 
6925  if (!check_tide_record(rec)) return NVFalse;
6926 
6927  figure_size(rec);
6928  read_tide_record(num, &tmp_rec);
6929  if (rec->header.record_size != tmp_rec.header.record_size) {
6930  /* Aaaaaaarrrrrgggggghhhh!!!! We have to move stuff! */
6931 
6932  /* Save where we are - end of record being modified. */
6933  pos = ftell(fp);
6934  assert(pos > 0);
6935 
6936  /* Figure out how big a block we need to move. */
6937  size = hd.end_of_file - pos;
6938  assert(size >= 0);
6939 
6940  /* Allocate memory and read the block. */
6941  if (size) {
6942  if ((block = (NV_U_BYTE *)calloc(size, sizeof(NV_U_BYTE))) == NULL) {
6943  perror("Allocating block");
6944  return NVFalse;
6945  }
6946  chk_fread(block, size, 1, fp);
6947  }
6948 
6949  /* Write out the modified record. */
6950  write_tide_record(num, rec);
6951 
6952  /* If we weren't at the end of file, move the block. */
6953  if (size) {
6954  chk_fwrite(block, size, 1, fp);
6955  free(block);
6956  }
6957 
6958  hd.end_of_file = ftell(fp);
6959 
6960  /* Close the file and reopen it to index the records again. */
6961  close_tide_db();
6962  open_tide_db(filename);
6963  }
6964 
6965  /* The easy way. No change to the record size. */
6966  else {
6967  write_tide_record(num, rec);
6968 
6969  /* Save the header info in the index. */
6970  tindex[num].record_size = rec->header.record_size;
6971  tindex[num].record_type = rec->header.record_type;
6972  tindex[num].reference_station = rec->header.reference_station;
6973  tindex[num].tzfile = rec->header.tzfile;
6974  tindex[num].lat = NINT(rec->header.latitude * hd.latitude_scale);
6975  tindex[num].lon = NINT(rec->header.longitude * hd.longitude_scale);
6976 
6977  /* AH maybe? */
6978  /* DWF: agree, same size record does not imply that name length
6979  is identical. */
6980  if (strcmp(tindex[num].name, rec->header.name) != 0) {
6981  free(tindex[num].name);
6982  tindex[num].name =
6983  (NV_CHAR *)calloc(strlen(rec->header.name) + 1, sizeof(NV_CHAR));
6984  strcpy(tindex[num].name, rec->header.name);
6985  }
6986  }
6987 
6988 #ifndef COMPAT114
6989  if (db) *db = hd.pub;
6990 #endif
6991 
6992  return (NVTrue);
6993 }
6994 
6995 /*****************************************************************************\
6996 
6997  Function infer_constituents - computes inferred constituents when
6998  M2, S2, K1, and O1 are given. This function fills the
6999  remaining unfilled constituents. The inferred constituents
7000  are developed or decided based on article 230 of
7001  "Manual of Harmonic Analysis and Prediction of Tides",
7002  Paul Schureman, C & GS special publication no. 98,
7003  October 1971. This function is really just for NAVO
7004  since we go to weird places and put in tide gages for
7005  ridiculously short periods of time so we only get a
7006  few major constituents developed. This function was
7007  modified from the NAVO FORTRAN program pred_tide_corr,
7008  subroutine infer.ftn, 08-oct-86.
7009 
7010  Synopsis infer_constituents (rec);
7011 
7012  TIDE_RECORD rec tide record
7013 
7014  Returns NV_BOOL NVFalse if not enough constituents
7015  available to infer others
7016 
7017  Author Jan C. Depner
7018  Date 08/01/02
7019 
7020  See libtcd.html for changelog.
7021 
7022 \*****************************************************************************/
7023 
7024 NV_BOOL infer_constituents(TIDE_RECORD *rec) {
7025  NV_U_INT32 i, j;
7026  NV_INT32 m2, s2, k1, o1;
7027  NV_FLOAT32 epoch_m2, epoch_s2, epoch_k1, epoch_o1;
7028 
7029  assert(rec);
7030  require((m2 = find_constituent("M2")) >= 0);
7031  require((s2 = find_constituent("S2")) >= 0);
7032  require((k1 = find_constituent("K1")) >= 0);
7033  require((o1 = find_constituent("O1")) >= 0);
7034 
7035  if (rec->amplitude[m2] == 0.0 || rec->amplitude[s2] == 0.0 ||
7036  rec->amplitude[k1] == 0.0 || rec->amplitude[o1] == 0.0)
7037  return (NVFalse);
7038 
7039  epoch_m2 = rec->epoch[m2];
7040  epoch_s2 = rec->epoch[s2];
7041  epoch_k1 = rec->epoch[k1];
7042  epoch_o1 = rec->epoch[o1];
7043 
7044  for (i = 0; i < hd.pub.constituents; ++i) {
7045  if (rec->amplitude[i] == 0.0 && rec->epoch[i] == 0.0) {
7046  for (j = 0; j < INFERRED_SEMI_DIURNAL_COUNT; ++j) {
7047  if (!strcmp(inferred_semi_diurnal[j], get_constituent(i))) {
7048  /* Compute the inferred semi-diurnal constituent. */
7049 
7050  rec->amplitude[i] =
7051  (semi_diurnal_coeff[j] / coeff[0]) * rec->amplitude[m2];
7052 
7053  if (fabs((NV_FLOAT64)(epoch_s2 - epoch_m2)) > 180.0) {
7054  if (epoch_s2 < epoch_m2) {
7055  epoch_s2 += 360.0;
7056  } else {
7057  epoch_m2 += 360.0;
7058  }
7059  }
7060  rec->epoch[i] = epoch_m2 + ((hd.speed[i] - hd.speed[m2]) /
7061  (hd.speed[s2] - hd.speed[m2])) *
7062  (epoch_s2 - epoch_m2);
7063  }
7064  }
7065 
7066  for (j = 0; j < INFERRED_DIURNAL_COUNT; ++j) {
7067  if (!strcmp(inferred_diurnal[j], get_constituent(i))) {
7068  /* Compute the inferred diurnal constituent. */
7069 
7070  rec->amplitude[i] =
7071  (diurnal_coeff[j] / coeff[1]) * rec->amplitude[o1];
7072 
7073  if (fabs((NV_FLOAT64)(epoch_k1 - epoch_o1)) > 180.0) {
7074  if (epoch_k1 < epoch_o1) {
7075  epoch_k1 += 360.0;
7076  } else {
7077  epoch_o1 += 360.0;
7078  }
7079  }
7080  rec->epoch[i] = epoch_o1 + ((hd.speed[i] - hd.speed[o1]) /
7081  (hd.speed[k1] - hd.speed[o1])) *
7082  (epoch_k1 - epoch_o1);
7083  }
7084  }
7085  }
7086  }
7087 
7088  return (NVTrue);
7089 }
7090 
7091 /* $Id: bit_pack.c 1805 2007-01-22 15:36:20Z flaterco $ */
7092 
7093 #include <math.h>
7094 #include <stdio.h>
7095 #include <assert.h>
7096 
7097 static NV_U_BYTE mask[8] = {0x00, 0x80, 0xc0, 0xe0, 0xf0, 0xf8, 0xfc, 0xfe},
7098  notmask[8] = {0xff, 0x7f, 0x3f, 0x1f, 0x0f, 0x07, 0x03, 0x01};
7099 
7100 /*****************************************************************************\
7101 
7102  DISTRIBUTION STATEMENT
7103 
7104  This source file is unclassified, distribution unlimited, public
7105  domain. It is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but
7106  WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
7107  MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.
7108 
7109 \*****************************************************************************/
7110 
7111 /***************************************************************************\
7112 * *
7113 * Function calculate_bits - Computes the number of bits needed *
7114 * to store a specified value. *
7115 * *
7116 * Synopsis calculate_bits (value); *
7117 * *
7118 * NV_U_INT32 value the value to store *
7119 * *
7120 * Returns NV_U_INT32 number of bits needed *
7121 * *
7122 * If value = 0, return is 0. *
7123 * No bits are needed to store a field whose only possible value is 0. *
7124 * *
7125 * Author Jan C. Depner *
7126 * *
7127 * Rewritten by DWF 2007-01-21 *
7128 * - "Range" was ambiguous and off-by-one errors existed in tide_db.c *
7129 * - Use of log10(x)/log10(2) was vulnerable to roundoff error *
7130 * - Conversion to floating point was unnecessary *
7131 * - Was giving the answer 0 for the input value 1 *
7132 * - God only knows what it did for the input value 0 (the logarithm *
7133 * is undefined) *
7134 * *
7135 \***************************************************************************/
7136 
7137 NV_U_INT32 calculate_bits(NV_U_INT32 value) {
7138  NV_U_INT32 bits = 32;
7139  NV_U_INT32 theBit = 0x80000000;
7140 
7141  while (value < theBit) {
7142  theBit >>= 1;
7143  --bits;
7144  }
7145  assert(bits <= 32);
7146  return bits;
7147 }
7148 
7149 /***************************************************************************\
7150 * *
7151 * Function bit_pack - Packs a long value into consecutive bits in *
7152 * buffer. *
7153 * *
7154 * Synopsis bit_pack (buffer, start, numbits, value); *
7155 * *
7156 * NV_U_BYTE buffer[] address of buffer to use *
7157 * NV_U_INT32 start start bit position in buffer *
7158 * NV_U_INT32 numbits number of bits to store *
7159 * NV_INT32 value value to store *
7160 * *
7161 * Description Packs the value 'value' into 'numbits' bits in 'buffer' *
7162 * starting at bit position 'start'. The majority of *
7163 * this code is based on Appendix C of Naval Ocean *
7164 * Research and Development Activity Report #236, 'Data *
7165 * Base Structure to Support the Production of the Digital *
7166 * Bathymetric Data Base', Nov. 1989, James E. Braud, *
7167 * John L. Breckenridge, James E. Current, Jerry L. *
7168 * Landrum. *
7169 * *
7170 * Returns void *
7171 * *
7172 * Author Jan C. Depner *
7173 * *
7174 \***************************************************************************/
7175 
7176 void bit_pack(NV_U_BYTE buffer[], NV_U_INT32 start, NV_U_INT32 numbits,
7177  NV_INT32 value) {
7178  NV_INT32 start_byte, end_byte, start_bit, end_bit, i;
7179 
7180  i = start + numbits;
7181 
7182  /* Right shift the start and end by 3 bits, this is the same as */
7183  /* dividing by 8 but is faster. This is computing the start and end */
7184  /* bytes for the field. */
7185 
7186  start_byte = start >> 3;
7187  end_byte = i >> 3;
7188 
7189  /* AND the start and end bit positions with 7, this is the same as */
7190  /* doing a mod with 8 but is faster. Here we are computing the start */
7191  /* and end bits within the start and end bytes for the field. */
7192 
7193  start_bit = start & 7;
7194  end_bit = i & 7;
7195 
7196  /* Compute the number of bytes covered. */
7197 
7198  i = end_byte - start_byte - 1;
7199 
7200  /* If the value is to be stored in one byte, store it. */
7201 
7202  if (start_byte == end_byte) {
7203  /* Rather tricky. We are masking out anything prior to the start */
7204  /* bit and after the end bit in order to not corrupt data that has */
7205  /* already been stored there. */
7206 
7207  buffer[start_byte] &= mask[start_bit] | notmask[end_bit];
7208 
7209  /* Now we mask out anything in the value that is prior to the */
7210  /* start bit and after the end bit. This is, of course, after we */
7211  /* have shifted the value left past the end bit. */
7212 
7213  buffer[start_byte] |=
7214  (value << (8 - end_bit)) & (notmask[start_bit] & mask[end_bit]);
7215  }
7216 
7217  /* If the value covers more than 1 byte, store it. */
7218 
7219  else {
7220  /* Here we mask out data prior to the start bit of the first byte. */
7221 
7222  buffer[start_byte] &= mask[start_bit];
7223 
7224  /* Get the upper bits of the value and mask out anything prior to */
7225  /* the start bit. As an example of what's happening here, if we */
7226  /* wanted to store a 14 bit field and the start bit for the first */
7227  /* byte is 3, we would be storing the upper 5 bits of the value in */
7228  /* the first byte. */
7229 
7230  buffer[start_byte++] |=
7231  (value >> (numbits - (8 - start_bit))) & notmask[start_bit];
7232 
7233  /* Loop while decrementing the byte counter. */
7234 
7235  while (i--) {
7236  /* Clear the entire byte. */
7237 
7238  buffer[start_byte] &= 0;
7239 
7240  /* Get the next 8 bits from the value. */
7241 
7242  buffer[start_byte++] |= (value >> ((i << 3) + end_bit)) & 255;
7243  }
7244 
7245  /* For the last byte we mask out anything after the end bit. */
7246 
7247  buffer[start_byte] &= notmask[end_bit];
7248 
7249  /* Get the last part of the value and stuff it in the end byte. */
7250  /* The left shift effectively erases anything above 8 - end_bit */
7251  /* bits in the value so that it will fit in the last byte. */
7252 
7253  buffer[start_byte] |= (value << (8 - end_bit));
7254  }
7255 }
7256 
7257 /***************************************************************************\
7258 * *
7259 * Function bit_unpack - Unpacks a long value from consecutive bits *
7260 * in buffer. *
7261 * *
7262 * Synopsis bit_unpack (buffer, start, numbits); *
7263 * *
7264 * NV_U_BYTE buffer[] address of buffer to use *
7265 * NV_U_INT32 start start bit position in buffer *
7266 * NV_U_INT32 numbits number of bits to retrieve *
7267 * *
7268 * Description Unpacks the value from 'numbits' bits in 'buffer' *
7269 * starting at bit position 'start'. The value is assumed *
7270 * to be unsigned. The majority of this code is based on *
7271 * Appendix C of Naval Ocean Research and Development *
7272 * Activity Report #236, 'Data Base Structure to Support *
7273 * the Production of the Digital Bathymetric Data Base', *
7274 * Nov. 1989, James E. Braud, John L. Breckenridge, James *
7275 * E. Current, Jerry L. Landrum. *
7276 * *
7277 * Returns NV_U_INT32 value retrieved from buffer *
7278 * *
7279 * Author Jan C. Depner *
7280 * *
7281 \***************************************************************************/
7282 
7283 NV_U_INT32 bit_unpack(NV_U_BYTE buffer[], NV_U_INT32 start,
7284  NV_U_INT32 numbits) {
7285  NV_INT32 start_byte, end_byte, start_bit, end_bit, i;
7286  NV_U_INT32 value;
7287 
7288  i = start + numbits;
7289 
7290  /* Right shift the start and end by 3 bits, this is the same as */
7291  /* dividing by 8 but is faster. This is computing the start and end */
7292  /* bytes for the field. */
7293 
7294  start_byte = start >> 3;
7295  end_byte = i >> 3;
7296 
7297  /* AND the start and end bit positions with 7, this is the same as */
7298  /* doing a mod with 8 but is faster. Here we are computing the start */
7299  /* and end bits within the start and end bytes for the field. */
7300 
7301  start_bit = start & 7;
7302  end_bit = i & 7;
7303 
7304  /* Compute the number of bytes covered. */
7305 
7306  i = end_byte - start_byte - 1;
7307 
7308  /* If the value is stored in one byte, retrieve it. */
7309 
7310  if (start_byte == end_byte) {
7311  /* Mask out anything prior to the start bit and after the end bit. */
7312 
7313  value =
7314  (NV_U_INT32)buffer[start_byte] & (notmask[start_bit] & mask[end_bit]);
7315 
7316  /* Now we shift the value to the right. */
7317 
7318  value >>= (8 - end_bit);
7319  }
7320 
7321  /* If the value covers more than 1 byte, retrieve it. */
7322 
7323  else {
7324  /* Here we mask out data prior to the start bit of the first byte */
7325  /* and shift to the left the necessary amount. */
7326 
7327  value = (NV_U_INT32)(buffer[start_byte++] & notmask[start_bit])
7328  << (numbits - (8 - start_bit));
7329 
7330  /* Loop while decrementing the byte counter. */
7331 
7332  while (i--) {
7333  /* Get the next 8 bits from the buffer. */
7334 
7335  value += (NV_U_INT32)buffer[start_byte++] << ((i << 3) + end_bit);
7336  }
7337 
7338  /* For the last byte we mask out anything after the end bit and */
7339  /* then shift to the right (8 - end_bit) bits. */
7340  if (mask[end_bit]) {
7341  value += (NV_U_INT32)(buffer[start_byte] & mask[end_bit]) >> (8 - end_bit);
7342  }
7343  }
7344 
7345  return (value);
7346 }
7347 
7348 /***************************************************************************\
7349 * *
7350 * Function signed_bit_unpack - Unpacks a signed long value from *
7351 * consecutive bits in buffer. *
7352 * *
7353 * Synopsis signed_bit_unpack (buffer, start, numbits); *
7354 * *
7355 * NV_U_BYTE buffer[] address of buffer to use *
7356 * NV_U_INT32 start start bit position in buffer *
7357 * NV_U_INT32 numbits number of bits to retrieve *
7358 * *
7359 * Description Unpacks the value from 'numbits' bits in 'buffer' *
7360 * starting at bit position 'start'. The value is assumed *
7361 * to be signed. The majority of this code is based on *
7362 * Appendix C of Naval Ocean Research and Development *
7363 * Activity Report #236, 'Data Base Structure to Support *
7364 * the Production of the Digital Bathymetric Data Base', *
7365 * Nov. 1989, James E. Braud, John L. Breckenridge, James *
7366 * E. Current, Jerry L. Landrum. *
7367 * *
7368 * Returns NV_INT32 value retrieved from buffer *
7369 * *
7370 * Author Jan C. Depner *
7371 * *
7372 \***************************************************************************/
7373 
7374 NV_INT32 signed_bit_unpack(NV_U_BYTE buffer[], NV_U_INT32 start,
7375  NV_U_INT32 numbits) {
7376  static NV_INT32 extend_mask = 0x7fffffff;
7377  NV_INT32 value;
7378 
7379  /* This function is not used anywhere that this case could arise. */
7380  assert(numbits > 0);
7381 
7382  value = bit_unpack(buffer, start, numbits);
7383 
7384  if (value & (1 << (numbits - 1))) value |= (extend_mask << numbits);
7385 
7386  return (value);
7387 }
